column10:
TLDR:
If you like games like DayZ then you'll most likely love this game. It's just like DayZ, except remove the zombies, replace them with hostile human NPCs who are armed to the teeth, add in a bit of base building and vehicles (only boats so far though). You will likely have to struggle to survive at first and to build a base and get established. This game has some very tense moments and a bit of a learning curve for most, but once you get things figured out it's much easier. So far this game has given me more hours of fun than dollars spent, so it's good for what it is.

Pros:
The game pretty much showers you with guns and ammo, they tend to be very easy to find and plentiful. There's a wide variety of them and it's fun to test out different ones. Your guns sometimes jam (the Scorpion SMG especially) on you and you'll have to clear it, adding more realism. Food and water tend to be more scarce than the guns and ammo or items to use for crafting or selling. You'll have to sometimes go fishing or hunt deer or duck to feed yourself. The game runs very smoothly for me, usually at around 100 fps, never dropping below 60, and the graphics are quite nice. There are missions, but they're simply to just kill all of the enemies at a certain location. I've completed a couple of easy and a couple of medium so far, I plan on moving on to a hard one next. I've been playing on a PVE server and grouped up with a random guy for a bit, which was fun. So far I haven't been killed by an bugs in the game, which is far more than I can say about DayZ where I'd get killed by glitches more than anything else. The game has some rudimentary base building and vehicles, but...

Cons:
So far it only has boats and there's not much building or crafting to be done, so that stuff seems to be more of an after thought in the game. From what I've heard they're working on adding land vehicles and the prone position. Yes, that's right you cannot go prone in game yet, which is a bit disappointing, but I've been able to get by without laying on my belly. Once those are implemented successfully the game will be improved, as the game can be a bit tedious at times having to run around so much. Another improvement I would like them to add is much more base building and crafting. As of right now there isn't much you can build, just a simple wooden base with crates to store items, a station to repair guns and paint your clothing, and a campfire to cook food.

You can call this unfinished and keep giving yourself hope that this game will actually change, but after coming back multiple times just to find out that its in the same exact state it's been in I can finally make a review. This game is garbage. Play any other survival shooter. PvP is pointless. Only exists so you can ruin other players runs and steel their loot. 0 mission, tracking, assignment, urge, quest, or whatever you want to call it to kill pvp. Therefore it's a trolls paradise for short term dopamine rushes. Now when it comes to pve only, you run into the risk of other players just coming and stealing your loot  after having completed a quest. especially if you die and have to run back from another town. (That's another thing, this game is basically a running simulator) Ai are the worst ai I've seen in a game since the 2002. The fist halo has more competent alien ai. The first stalker has more competent ai. I'm not exaggerating either. THEY ARE AWFUL. So enjoyment of pve is nonexistent. Keep telling us more traversing is coming, i don't care. Give a kindergartner unreal engine and they'll figure out how to give you a car faster than these guys can. Feel free to cry in my comments. Thank you and please don't waste your time.

it is with a heavy heart that I must address the pervasive issue of hacking and cheating that plagues Deadside, tarnishing what could otherwise be a promising and immersive gaming experience. Deadside initially captured the attention of players with its expansive open-world environment and intense survival mechanics. However, the game's potential is overshadowed by the rampant spread of hacking and cheating, which has transformed what should be a thrilling struggle for survival into a frustrating and unfair ordeal.

One of the most glaring manifestations of hacking and cheating in Deadside is the prevalence of aimbots and wallhacks in player-versus-player (PvP) encounters. It is disheartening to witness skilled players being overshadowed by individuals who rely on automated aim assistance to gain an unfair advantage. The result is an unbalanced and demoralizing gameplay experience, where victory is not determined by skill or strategy, but by the ability to exploit illicit software.

Furthermore, the integrity of Deadside's economy is undermined by players who engage in duping exploits and item manipulation. This not only devalues in-game currency and items but also disrupts the delicate balance of the game's economy, rendering legitimate gameplay progression meaningless. As a result, honest players are left feeling disillusioned and disenfranchised, with their hard-earned efforts overshadowed by the exploits of cheaters.

Despite numerous reports from the community regarding hacking and cheating, the response from the developers has been disappointingly inadequate. While occasional ban waves may temporarily address the symptoms of the problem, the root causes remain largely unaddressed, allowing cheaters to resurface with impunity. This lack of decisive action only serves to embolden cheaters and perpetuate a toxic gaming environment where fair play is a rare commodity.

In conclusion, the pervasive presence of hacking and cheating in Deadside represents a significant blemish on an otherwise promising survival game. Unless urgent measures are taken to address this issue, the game risks losing its player base and tarnishing its reputation irreparably. As a fan of Deadside and the survival genre as a whole, I implore the developers to prioritize the fight against hacking and cheating, lest the integrity of the game continue to decay into oblivion.
VERY GOOD

I sank a LOT of time into this game. Over 350 hours. It still feels a bit like a poor man's Tarkov.  It needs PVP quests. The base building still feels like it's not worth the time it takes. The AI is SO simple and stupid - let off a few shots and  then watch the AI come running around a corner, allowing you to take them out one by one. 

it's fun for a limited time but soon the game's lack of depth starts to really show. For me this game is a middle thumb. It's ok.

Generally I like the principle of having a DayZ like game that's more casual, less time consuming to play. But I do feel like they made the game a bit too casual. There are respawn points all over the map, rarely more than 1km away from wherever you may have died. This makes PvP pretty awkward, as you basically have to loot and run within a minute of getting a kill or you risk getting surprised by the guy you just offed. Since player bases can have respawn beacons too this only makes the problem worse, as they can then return fully geared out. 

The AI is either dumb as bricks (easy) or Ready Or Not levels of cracked (hard+). Easy is no challenge at all, Hard+ has to be cheesed. Generally though you soon find yourself without a reason to do missions, as most stuff can simply be bought in the safe zone and you generally find a lot of good loot very easily.

The basebuilding is terrible and janky - I am not sure why they tried emulating DayZ here - there are a million games out there that did this better. 

All in all this game is fun enough for a few hours but fizzles out very quickly. Considering the above issues though, I'll give it a Not Recommended until I see some improvement in those areas.

Review update: i tried pushing further and i even enjoyed the game for quite a while, but frankly it is a complete mess. I don't recommend wasting your money on this game considering it is void of anything meaningful and provides an irritating experience the moment you are actually playing it and not just looking at things. Just so i am not leaving the devs with nothing, i will say that the water bottle/canteens are essentially useless because they store so little fluid considering you drink 20 out of 60 in one drink for the canteen, which is the second highest water storage in. The guns apparently do very little damage to an unprotected enemy and sometimes it can take multiple headshots to kill a bot not even wearing a beanie. The snipers common sniper scope is so terrible that you are better off using iron sights a whole mile out. Enemies spawn wherever they feel like. I literally got swarmed by almost 50 enemies in a location (all bots) and they just kept coming. I dropped almost all of them but was killed by a rush at the end. The bots literally snap to you when you get within a distance. There is no indication of them hearing you or having spotted you, they just snap on and start firing like AI with no bonework whatsoever. The limited water sources is also highly frustrating, especially when you are dehydrated and you've been to all the wells in 5 different locations and got zero water. Clothing items that should definitely house more inventory are only capable of fitting next to no extra items. The intention for the player to build a base is absolutely abysmal. This game is not rust, and it never will be (at least i hope). My point of that is that the inventory space in the game is not at all polished and it is horribly small for how much leg work the game devs are tasking you with (and with all the constant bot spawns) in order to build said base. I also noticed you can't sell ammo to the guns dealer which makes me question if any thought was put into even the safe zones. And the items in the shop are outrageously expensive. explain how a funny mask is 76,000 but a god dahmed AKSM is 15,000. Balanced economy my ass bro, even gucci isn't that steep. You make money by selling items and looting it off dead bots. Though, i don't believe you can get money off of bots unless you are already carrying cash, which puts you at risk of losing whatever you take with you. There is a lot more that i could list off, but frankly i've already dropped a good handful of issues.This game is ridiculous, it's quite dead player wise, and i don't imagine it will ever become anything even good.
Old part:
I truly hope that the devs are still working on the game, because there is so much room for improvement. I do enjoy the game, and it is very beautiful, but it's as if barely any real thought went into this game. there is no way (at least dependably taught) to purify water, which means you MUST travel to a well to fill up bottles and your canteen. Though i spent an entire game coming across empty wells in every single town or spot i went into. literally every single well was empty for no reason. It also takes a ridiculous amount of fire to kill someone if you are not immediately aiming for the head (which in most cases, i am by default) even if the enemies are not wearing a vest or anything reasonably protective. I also wound up with two gun flashlights which are so terrible at illuminating i'd rather just shine an actual flashlight at my monitor to see if that helps. When i had first started playing, i had noticed that i was getting an overabundance of food and drink, and later in playing i was receiving next to no food items after fully looting two whole POI's. I don't know if it's due to server rules and setting item discoveries to a fixed loot drop, but if so there should be some type of indication of said rules clearly listed. Also, the safe zones are absolute crap. I worked very hard in a server to stay alive and keep myuself fed until i got to the safe zone packed with gear, and when i finally get into the safe zone i immediately have an enemy spawn in front of me and kill me. I've also noticed that the vaulting is very screwed up and doesn't really function unless you stand still in front of what you are attempting to vault. I have all of my experience streamed on my youtube channel by the way. 
For as enjoyable as this game can be, it can become such a truly infuriating experience because it is, in my opinion based off of gathered experience as a new player, not very well tuned at all. This game feels as though it was crafted together and then not really touched again. I'm not even sure if it would be wise to be hopeful about this game, because frankly i gave this game a lot of time in my wishlist before purchase and frankly i'm quite dissapointed with the experience they have to offer.

OK, so I finally decided to pull the trigger on this one. I really am not one to write reviews, however, I really like where this game and where it is going. That said it would be nice to see some things get polished that really are horrible. 
Number one: A guide: like the one that's in State Of Decay. Really helps get one up to speed on the how to. 
Number 2: The movement/mechanics: You get stuck on everything while in a building. Furniture, boxes etc... which in certain situations can lead to death. If I get outplayed fine, getting stuck on a box, crate etc. and killed because of it pisses me off. It would be nice for the movement to be as fluent indoors as it is outdoors. Might as well mention the wolves, the wolf I encountered was like a card board cut out and jittery in movement. Again, unrealistic.
Number 3: The sounds/Audio: This is the biggest one for me. Certain sounds are very clunky and just unrealistic, especially the walking/running. This is not even close to the sound of walking and being highly repetitive it drives me nuts. Sounds like your a zombie dragging your feet. When the sounds are realistic it just makes the game play that much better IMO. Other than that, I am enjoying the game thus far.

I am once again changing my review for Deadside. The game has turned into a cash grab, with no clear plans to ever finish development.

As we roll into the 2024 I decided to check it out again and almost nothing has changed. It's close to the same game it was two years ago. In addition to the game being in an early state of development, it has been pumped with cosmetic "Events". I don't have a problem with optional cosmetics, it's a good way to generate income, but there is a limit. There is a problem with a game that hasn't been finished, that isn't receiving real updates, pumping out cosmetics for profit.

I would say this game is better than DayZ in a lot of ways.
It's fun as long as you play this with friends, i was having a hard time playing this game solo since it got rather boring just running around alone all the time and dealing with a dificult AI/Bot's. I ended up running back and forth from same spots killing enemies and collecting my corpse a lot on PVE servers.

The map area is rather large for you to explore, the problem i see with this game is that it's a lot of running and scouting out enemies. So far in the game there is boats to make you travel faster but other than that i miss some sort of more fast traveling options.

More Storage  in safe zones is something i miss in this game, i get it that you only have a limitied space to deal with but i would like a option to upgrade my storage in the trader with a couple of slots so i dont need to make a base after a couple of misions just to store my cash and ammo.

It is a fun game, just a bit punishing for playing alone. Make sure to get a base up fast or you will be punished with using the weapons the bot's are dealing with just to conserve ammo!
 8/10 would still recomend!
Good game!

There isn't one thing about this game that feels complete. Everything and anything could use updating/fixing. Gun play, movement, looting, POI's, AI etc. Could be a good competitor with Day-Z if they put more effort into it. Game seems abandoned.

AI: Sometimes don't make noise when moving. They target you through solid barriers. They will prefire corners if you re-peek from the same location quickly. You get targeted from 300+ meters out sometimes and there really is no way of sneaking up on some of the areas. They're either aim bot or storm troopers. They get caught in corners and behind doors sometimes. Wolfs will agro you when you're in ANY location, running straight into military bases to chase you. 

Gun-play: Head bob while ADS'ing is gnarly. If you play on high DPI, you will have to lower it in order to play since in-game sens doesn't go low enough. 

Movement: Feels just like Day-Z but worse. Switching weapons, equipping food, tools etc all cancel auto run. Clunky and slow. Not enough transportation for mobility across the map.

Game-play: Unable to reload while running. You have to continuously hold Left-click to consume food, drink water etc. No option in settings for a press lean, instead of hold. If you aren't using NVIDIA shaders during night time you are automatically at a huge disadvantage. You can get stuck in walls if you close a door on yourself. Building a base as a solo takes ages. Switching weapon attachments between equipped weapons is tedious. Items sometimes don't stack in your inventory when you already have said item. You can loot a very large radius just by pressing TAB (through walls and floors as well)

If anything I mentioned in this review isn't accurate or already has a solution please let me know. I tried to be as objective as possible.
this game is going in an awesome direction and shows promise to be top tier in the future. im excited to see what they do with it! Shout out to my man loaf too

I was really excited to play this game for the following reasons (PROs):

-No zombies
-Open world
-Survival
-Option to play only against AI

The CONS which have led me to the decision to stop playing until fixed:

-The AI:
      -You'll see a group of bad guys about 600 metres away and the next thing you know they are 2 metres in front of you. 
        They could not realistically cover that distance in 5 seconds.
      -Or you just complete a mission and have collected the loot and if you are there just a little too long the enemies will 
        respawn right on you.
      -They can shoot you with great accuracy even if it is night time and you are behind a bush.

-Vehicles:
      -Only a boat. Enough said.

-Envrionment:
      -You can't drink water from streams or other bodies of water.

I am hoping that future updates will fix the above however until then I cannot bring myself to playing the game further.

Anyway, I've been sort of ill for the last few years and I don't get to play PC games nearly as much. This was very fun for me. Sure there's some bugs, like if you put your FOV above 80 you get game hitching when scoping in. Always played between 104 and 111 in most games. Sadly, not an option for this one.  The map BADLY needs better zoom control. I can't see well and the map will only zoom in a little bit and I can't make out the icons. Hope they fix that! A couple of keybindings aren't listed in the controls either, which is strange. 

Anyway, I'll probably be playing this as my main game. Want to buy Tarkov, but that's a whole new level, so holding off.  Deadside is similar but quite a bit easier.

I really wish I could give this a thumbs up as it is not a bad game on it's own and I wish the developers well on their success, but unfortunately in today's market, this genre is flooded with EA like games and one's already known (Rust, DayZ).

You get to build a base on one of the 50 player servers, most people have them with lookouts overlooking the entire roads and approaches to the base for easy snipe kills and loots... smart, but these bases are close to mission areas, i can see this being abused. Fine, EA can be tweaked.

Gunplay is fun, really liked the way it handles. But the game itself feels like a mixup of DayZ and Rust. 

Having missions to do and traders location is cool, but the map doesn't feel that massive. 

Personally, I like the more realistic survival fps games; this is one of them, but I prefer SCUM and Escape From Tarkov over this. I don't see any outstanding features that can put this forward in front of what is already existing and kinda feel like this will have the H1Z1 life-cycle. Fun, just nothing unique where it hasn't been done before.

This game allows for a casual ability to make progress while keeping the survival and open world FPS hardcore feel. I also like that it gives you the ability to get where you need to be to experience all of the content without having to grind. nothing against the super hardcore games, I enjoy them. But I also found those needs met with what this game throws at you. A.I. definitely needs some work, sometimes it feels spot on...most however their LOS is super crazy far and they will NOT quit coming for you, once they see you they tend to always know where you are. Sometimes not unless you completely leave Aggro range all together and then re-engage.    Overall I'd say its a 3.8/5

Except it lacks the DayZ charm, atmosphere, map love, realism, survival elements, intense fights  Everything is just so watered down it leaves a lot left to be desired.   

I can see the watered down gameplay being appealing to the more casual gamer that doesn't want to put the time into learning games like DayZ or SCUM, but if you come from those games, this will leave a lot to be desired. I currently have 450 hours in the game, and will continue to play. I have experience in Rust and Dayz and I can say this game has been my favorite out of all. The simplicity makes this game a better pick for anyone who don't have time to play 24/7. You cannot get raided unless you die to another online player, and even then there is a chance you won't drop a raid token. Once your raid token is popped, any other players in server have 1 hour to gather c4 and raid your base. It takes 1 c4 for any type of build to destroy. (Loot boxes are not lootable for others not assigned to base, only when raid is active of course.) There are many missions scattered around the map varying from easy to epic. There are also loot drops and convoys that give high tier military loot (weapons, attachments, and even better armor). There are also different places around the map that contain locked crates which can be opened with red keys found at heli crashes, dead NPC's clothing, or mission crates. Inside these locked crates are various types of guns with many different possible camos that can only be obtained by opening these crates. Loot obtained from missions, drops, etc. can be stored at any of the two safe zones located north and south of the map (Large green circles). Once loot storage is full, you can sell unwanted things to trader, or you can obtain a hammer, axe, nails, and wood and start building your base! Doors can be locked with code locks, and crates can be made to store loot. (8 crates max as of this update) There are many guides on the game as i cannot explain everything. This game has exceeded my expectations leading me to leave this giant review. I highly recommend giving this game a try as it goes on sale often, even though it is already a fantastic price for what the Devs have givin us!

It's a great game. An open world with plenty of exploration. 
The crafting is simple and almost every item in game can be used.
Weapons have wear to them but can be repaired in your base with parts from other disassembled weapons.
Plenty of missions, starting with easy, medium, hard and then Epic as well as crashed helicopter missions.
The helicopter guys are on steroids or pissed off they just crashed, so beware.
And then there is the convoy. Iron sights from 400 meters, and they hurt.
As the mission difficulty goes up, so does the Tier of loot. Scopes, weapons, armor etc..
Magnification scopes higher than 2X can only be obtained from higher missions, or found in the world, and not sold.
If your weapons and tactics are good the Epics can be soloed, just be warned they will come in herds, so have a high tier weapon with a fast rate of fire or a high capacity shotgun.
There are rubber and swamp boats for traversing the world and can be found all over randomly.
Deer and ducks can be hunted for meat that can be cooked.
Your hunger and thirst will last for quite a while.
I have seen some games that I refunded due to being almost dead 10 minutes after eating, but these guys got it right.
The officialdswiki is a great source guide to enjoying this game. Nothing is hard or confusing about it.

In 2024, it is still impossible to play this game on Linux, due to the developers REFUSING to refactor their engine to accommodate Easy Anti Cheat's Proton API.

That game was functional, using EAC, until 2022. All of a sudden it stopped being functional, you get kicked by EAC after one minute of online play according to all forums; and the official answer from the devs are "It is impossible for us to make EAC work on Linux", which is a straight up lie; I play video games with way better anti-cheats, and way more AAA than this, on my Linux machine, without a single issue or manual configuration.

That is how actually easy Proton made Linux gaming possible. Just needs devs to update their engines. Refusing to update your engine for a glitch cutting you out from thousands of potential players, because you seem lost in 2014.

We've been playing competitive shooters on Linux with as much safety and more performance than on Windows since 2019. Enjoy the refund; the dev team shows no actual capacity to take this project to anything substancial if a simple engine refactor is too much to ask after 2 years.

Support is non-existent, whether through Discord, email, or Discussions. The developers display a complete lack of interest in assisting newcomers, myself included. Regrettably, I had to return the product due to this disregard. The indifference is palpable. Moreover, there's a concerning trend of arbitrary bans, with the added risk of being denied a refund based on personal grievances, especially when expressing criticism (referring to the toxicity that I've read about).

I've personally experienced the aftermath of a similar situation in an MMO game, where the creator's code was stolen, leading to his traumatic experience and personal drama, perceiving all unusual things as hostility. Despite being a devoted fan since childhood, I was unjustly banned by the creator, who targeted me randomly after I spoke the truth on his Discord. While some users began to realize the situation, he banned me without cause, alleging flooding, a claim that was untrue. As a mere sound designer with no knowledge of coding, I found myself caught up in an unjust ban.

Considering this, it raises the question: are the Deadside developers similarly hostile and ignorant? I empathize with other players who may face random bans, as I know firsthand the frustration and disappointment associated with such actions.

This game has really come a long way over the past few years.  The missions are plenty but not so many that you can't ignore them if you want, the building has GREATLY improved, and raiding mechanics are pretty good too.  There is still more work to be done on building and storage (for those survival hoarders out there) but over all the PVP is pretty tight.

Game WAS at slow pace with updates, BUT was recently acquired by new studio(I think a year ago, you can checkout all the progress they have made on update list since then from big to small QoL improvements that have greatly improved the game overall); has been way more promising and faster paced with news of deadlines, and goals met. Recently they added a new city location and also have greatly expanded the map with adding little things in areas that used to be open/ plain and boring.. Only real issues I have is still no  cars that can be driven, should be soon as they got boats now. They have addressed and fixed a lot of the NPC "Aim Botting Behavior Issues" Anyways... Game is basically like a stand alone version of those custom "Tarkov DayZ" servers, but with the potential of better optimizations, etc.. 

1. Open World Map - (Similar to DayZ)
2. NPC / Patrols - on the map (Similar to Tarkov)
3. Safe Zones - (Similar to the DayZ custom wanna be Tarkov Servers) 
4. Player base building, (Similar to DayZ custom wanna be Tarkov Servers) I never base build in this game as safe areas is plenty in my opinion. 
5. Safe Areas - has traders for buying and selling items, and storage for items you don't want to risk taking out of safe zone. (Similar to DayZ custom wanna be Tarkov Servers)
6. Crafting Menu - tells you what items you need in order to craft said item; so you don't have to find out the recipe on your own.
7. Events/ Missions - randomly happen on the map, with multiple in many areas active throughout the map, with ranking of different difficulty levels that you can see on map so you know how hard the event/mission will be before heading out. Decent game tbh, pretty polished given whats implemented. Its tough, cos the AI is no joke but any comments re it being too hard isn't strictly accurate (im no pro btw). Its not Dayz though, the AI have gear and guns and decent pathing so you cant just run about opening and closing doors lol, you defo need to use cover, retreat as reengage often.

As a general rule of thumb you cant steam into tier 3 and elite bases unless you're moderately geared or with a squad (or just an FPS god - Im not lol).  Its less the difficultly of said AI bots though, more the sheer number so if solo'ing or under geared you just get overwhelmed. 

Solo'ing and PvE provides tiered bases to raid, convoys to capture, helidrops and cargo drops to capture as well as random encounters/street patrols to either swerve or engage.

PvP has all the above plus the PvP element obvs 

Unlike Dayz though, gear acquisition is far quicker and dying, whilst annoying isnt hair pullingly, keyboard launchingly annoying, just respawn at nearest town and you can usually just run in grab it and retreat in order to re group/plan

Base building is fine, you cant get raided unless you activate a raid token (from what I've seen?) however an 8 container cap soon gets full if you have a squad of more than a couple. 

Talking of squads, you can invite members to your base, squad up and access everything as expected but any tactical markers you place as a squad can only be viewed by you still which is a bit annoying imo

Finally, i usually host my own servers, have done for rust/ark/dayz/valheim/7d2d etc etc but this time decided to use Gportal and frankly its both well priced (imo) and super slick. £18 for a month, instantly online, backup and save storage for days. Can also easily update loot re-spawn chance and ratio etc etc, then when fully geared increase AI difficulty ....sadly if struggling with stock difficulty you cannot reduce their lethality lol

In 16 hours I have a good understanding of the game. Its gun-play and detail is fantastic. The graphics are amazing and it really can run on a toaster. The A.I is good but sometimes they can see you further than eyes can see lol. Other than that they are good. Loot scaling is good, progression is easy and the further you go up the harder good loot becomes to get, so skill is involved. The loot storage systems are fine. The base building is a little grindy but very worth it in the long run. Water and food are a bit annoying but do their job and add pressure into the game, much better than rust. Only negative things i could say is the base building is very precise, and that A.I stop scaling after medium/hard missions, even though they go up to elite with others like event challenges. Overall 9/10. Extremely addictive and the rush yuo get when killing Mega Geared players is unbeatable.

Deadside is a freaking exciting dark multiplayer shooter that transports players to a dark world after the apocalypse. Mixing elements of survival, shooting and exploration makes this game exciting and fun for fans of post-apocalyptic settings.

One of Deadside's strengths is its expansive open map, offering a variety of biomes, from forests and fields to urban ruins. Players can freely move around this world, completing quests, exploring areas and fighting other players or AI opponents.

The main focus of the game is survival. Players need to look for resources, weapons, ammunition and other equipment to increase their chances of survival. The crafting and leveling system allows players to create items and improve skills, which adds depth to the gameplay.

One of the main elements of Deadside's appeal is its PvP combat. Battles with other players are intense and dynamic, requiring tactics and skill. At the same time, the game offers a safety mode so that newcomers can get comfortable and explore the world without constant threat.

Despite some technical problems at the beginning, the developers are actively working on improvements and updates, which gives hope for a further improvement in the gaming experience.

Deadside offers an immersive post-apocalyptic world where survival, combat and exploration intertwine to create an exciting and fast-paced gameplay experience for fans of the genre.

If you've played DayZ, the first thing you'll note is that this is basically DayZ - except:
- no kidnapping, torture and murder of other players. (PVP is ok. Binding someone, taking all their stuff and then shooting them in the head feels a little too far.... none of that in Deadside)
- no zombies. I was a little surprised by this.
- no cars - they did add boats in the last patch, but you don't "own" a boat. It will de-spawn and go back to one of the random starting spots. 

- You can pick your spawn area -  there is a 10 min timer on this, so if you're in a hot battle and die within 10 minutes, you'll have to pick another spot.
- your dead body is marked so you can find it.
- you can mark the map so you can know where you're heading without constantly opening the map
- base building is simpler but still time consuming. Trees never despawn so you could build your entire base with one tree. 
- the trader helps and the storage there is a nice perk.
- everyone will have automatic weapons after a few hours/days on the server
- there are non PVP servers so people actually work together to take down more difficult targets.
- food /water use is a bit more realistic in being used up by activity.

The BAD:
No cars means that you're walking. 

EVERYWHERE.   The addition of boats to the game has largely alleviated this.  Also, when you die, you can typically spawn at a village nearby.

You have no stamina bar and it doesn't seem to drain food/water much faster (if at all) but walking everywhere compounds with the spawning mechanic for missions.

 The chopping mechanic is awful. Whoever did the animation has never chopped wood, never held an axe and there is a VERY narrow spot in which you will actually hit the tree.  They need to expand the area that lands a valid strike and make it so you're not standing practically IN the tree to hit it.

The UGLY:

The AI bots are deadly accurate and  they can see you through foliage that should be blocking their view. It doesn't matter if they're not using a scope. They'll cut you down in a single shot from 150 meters. 

You CAN sneak, but you have no good quiet kill methods. The bots hear your gun shots (of course) and will swarm you - maybe like a trained military would? But there is no morale factor. If you mow them down, they do not run nor hesitate. They know where you are, even if you've moved after you sniped that shot and will turn the corner and pop you with their deadly bot aim.



The AI can definitely see at night so there doesn't seem to be very good night/sneak mechanics. There is No use in going out at night vs aimbots who are unaffected by the dark.  Build your base instead. Go duck hunting.

Melee combat mechanics are terrible. Weapons that should have reach (swinging an axe) have ZERO range. 

Gun terrain interference - They have a somewhat unique mechanic where if you get too close to a wall, you will bring your gun up ...because... hey, guns can't go through walls....so. Its "realistic"  The problem is that it is far too sensitive. You want to snipe through a window? Forget resting against a wall or window well to steady your aim. Well, if you're anywhere near the edges (bottom or sides) you are going to hug your gun to your chest. To make the shot, you'd better climb into the window. STUPID.

Prone - there IS NO PRONE. They've been talking about it since 2020. You have a ghillie suit and no prone? They probably can't make it work because the terrain gun interference mechanic probably makes you hug the gun to your belly when you go prone... *sigh*

THE WORST:
Missions and Spawn mechanics.

Not sure who decided this, but you can be in a base doing a mission and have killed all the enemies and "blip" mission randomly despawns. Bad guys and rewards, gone.  Or worse. You've pretty much killed them all and *BOOM* a whole new squad just appears right on top of you. What?!

I decided to take on a convoy.  Killed them all and as I'm running to pick up the case? DESPAWN. 

I'm checking the map for nearby missions. Closest mission is 2KM out. Welp... Head out!   Almost there...? BLIP.  Mission despawns.

Server reset teleportation.  Twice since the last patch, I've been teleported accross the map to a random spot when the server reset.

Playing together? Great. You'll be throwing your stuff on the floor to share it and won't have the ability to let your friend access your secure storage.  If you have a lock on your door, your small boxes can be shared....but you can make 3. That's it. 

So forget building a base together. Yeah, one of you could play lumberjack and supply the wood.

You cannot host your own server.

Having had "Deadside" since just after it's release the game has shown continued improvements and regular updates. The game can be played either on PVP - Player V Player or PVE - Player V Environment Servers. I personally like to play PVE and "Deadside" provides enough variety to make this play style enjoyable. 

AI Missions - There are a variety of missions which often are easier played with friends or teaming up with somone on the server and sharing the loot. The missions are either in set areas ranging in difficulty from fairly easy to damn hard with better Loot on each level of difficulty or Money Convoys which have extreme AI but the best Loot. 

BASE BUILDING - The base building is well implemented with a variety of preformed foundation frames that you build on. The difference on this to most other survival games is you need to put a frame in place to support your next level of walls floors ceiling etc. You can add teams to the flagpole to enable them to build and access the building.  
  Top tip make a water collector as soon as you can Wells are on the map but are often dry. Thirst and hunger kill and disable you.

MAP - This has been updated and has a zoom option as well as "Shift  L Mouse Click" add/remove  Waypoint markers. You can add multiple markers and they are different coloured so you can have your base the safe zone and your mission co-ords all at the same time but easily recognised. 

Longevity of Gameplay - I find it fairly easy to gear up and start again on another server but once I have completed a base done a load of missions explored some new areas of the expanding map I do get bored. But that is after a good few hours and the challenge is available on many servers add PVP and it's a lot harder. 

Conclusion - Is it worth buying If you like Survival PVP PVE and a decent challenge it will easily provide well over 20 hours of entertainment. I have 82hrs and still want to explore the NEW City. The Dev's keep adding more so yes I recommend "Deadside" compared to DAY'z The AI are smarter and harder than the Z's.  The missions are comparable to Arma2 Day'z Missions providing loot and challenge. The Crafting is Similar to Rust / ARK but different in it's own way. 

Have Fun and use trees for cover!

Why the f*ck did I ever buy this game in the first place????? 

- HORRIBLE MOVEMENT. You may as well be drunk the entire time because it feels like it.

- WHAT GUN PLAY? The gun play is so bad. You shoot a pistol more than once and the recoil has you shooting birds out of the sky. 

- WHAT LOOT? All possible loot is found on the ground, not in containers like literally any other survival game of this type. Not only that the loot spawns are so random you will find yourself running into 6 or 7 different houses just to find a broken flashlight or a plastic bottle.

- AI AIMBOT. Even the easy AI can spot you from hundreds of meters away and start plinking you. Including the EASY mission AI. Not only that, if you are just freshly spawned and only have a pistol or a knife, may as well find the nearest body of water to die in. Save yourself the trouble.

- JUST DONT BUY. I bought this game when it first came out and it was mildly entertaining. I have played this POS for an hour total. 30 mins on release, 30 minutes just now. This is an hour I will never get back.

I would categorize this game as "Tarkov-lite".  It's very fun, lots of PvE and interesting survival aspects.  AI is entertaining and will attempt to track you down.   As of the date of this review (12/30/2023) the only vehicles are boats.  Base building is possible however i have not begun to explore that aspect yet.  

It's for sure possible to do what we used to do in the "Last Oasis" days in that you can zero-to-hero your way to gear on any server.  

PvE only servers will let you get experience building bases

If you are looking for a nice alternative to Tarkov to work on honing your looter-shooter skills, this is definitely the game for that!

Other than that good game.

A more simplified version of survival MMOs like Scum and Dayz. More fast-paced with getting loot, gearing up, and engaging in PVP. I think for gamers that have a more limited time to game, but love these types of games it is perfect. The gun play is pretty good too. 50 player servers and PVE only options.
beautiful specimen of a game, truly an outer body experience.

So far I am having a blast just doing AI missions for better gear, I haven't done much crafting or anything else really. I like how it doesn't take forever to get some decent gear, my problem with DayZ was that there is barely any loot most places and it was too much grind. I enjoy the faster paced gameplay here. I like the safezones and stash system although that might be taking away from the base building aspect. Trading system is good. The PVE is pretty good but the AI could use some improvement but its still very fun. So overall this game is pretty good so far. I wish for a deeper survival system (illness/exposure/injury). I also wish they would add some zombies or infected or something while decreasing the amount of armed human enemies. That would make for a great PVE experience. Then I would consider this game to be amazing.

I am a 45 -year -old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father raising my son, who is now 14 years old. My son won this game from his uncle, so we installed him on his computer and he started playing. Until the end of the week he had 24 hours in this game. This was horrible for me, because it was hard to find ways to spend time with my son, because he is always with friends or just watching Youtube. So I decided to do a Steam account and get this game to see if I could play beside him. I bought the game, chose my skin and world and started playing, but I was stuck in what you should do. I asked my son for help and he organized a game for me to participate. I loved it, because it was the best time I spent with my son since my wife died. Since then, this game has approached me and my son again and now we spend time together away from home as well. This game reminded me that there is fun in everything, and I brought many happy memories to me and my son.

Super fun even with how little there is to do. AI is overpowered, but it makes it challenging? You never know if you're going to kill them easily or if you will get one-tapped immediately. I'm excited for all the updates that are coming hopefully soon. Right now, there are only boats to navigate the map and they don't spawn too often, so I am hoping for some type of new vehicle because I am tired of walking. The missions are the best part of the game so far it's something that I enjoy, but it does get very repetitive and you end up being bored until another mission pops up. Thankfully, there are multiple missions up at one time, but you better get there first. Also, if you think there are zombies because of the name.. like me... think again, there are none and the only danger is wolves, bots, the elements, or other people.

Slow development cycle / new feature releases.

Pros: Overall graphics are great.

Dev team as of recently has been catering to roleplayers, haven't touched this game in about a year. They ban you from their discord for speaking your opinion and criticizing the game. They release roadmaps for the year but doesnt release the content within these roadmaps throughout the year, and in Loafs own words (one of the devs for this game) roadmaps are "just ideas of what we want to add not things we are working on." I used to love this game, had the pleasure of running the most popular server with some amazing people for about a year before it shutting down. Hopefully one day there is better communication between the devs and the community, because at the moment the private testers in their own words are "too scared to speak out about issues in the game" as they believe they will lose their private tester permissions. 

TLDR; Dev team is surrounded by yes men, they ban opposing opinions, and give out false promises.

It took me a while to pull the trigger on this game, watching videos and reading the reviews left me sceptical although finally buying on sale was a smart decision. 
Yes the map is huge and it takes a while to get around, the loot is scarce and you run into storage issues immediately but overall the gun-play is v satisfying and once you reach a mission you are really fighting to survive, especially on the higher tier ones. 

If you are on the fence, buy the game (it's cheap), support the devs and hopefully all the little problems will be ironed out soon. 

(p.s. If I can leave one note for development consideration, add more POI's and things to do around the map while you are getting to your next destination)

Quick and short: The game feels and runs amazing. Compared to other games in this survival/looter genre, I think this one takes the cake. The gameplay, gun mechanics and everything functional about the game is amazing.

However, there's a few things that sort of sucks about this game, and it's been a part of it since day one. Sure there are plenty of missions and things to explore on the map, but it doesn't take many hours to reach the "endgame". Do a few easy mission, gather loot and better gear, and move up to the harder missions. Do this correctly and quickly, you can reach top tier loot within a few hours to be honest. After that, it feels a little empty and repetitive.

I have not since it came out built a base. I remember it being a really grindy and tiresome process that takes forever. How it works today, I can't know. All I know is that you don't really need a base, as the best loot can be saved in safe zones. Bases and chests have a timer until they disappear unless you login every 7 days I think.

The map is huge and awesome, with many great points of interest. However, this comes to a disadvantage as there are limited transportation vehicles in the game, and you spend probably 40% of your time running from A to B. There are boats in the game, but you cannot lock them for more than 30 minutes, and after that they simply despawn. There are no land vehicles as of this review. No idea if there will be any, as it has been requested since the day the game came out from players.

If you are looking for a better experience just get dayz, no point in playing a game with auto aim AI that shoot you from 300+ meters before entering a town. I respect this game is trying to be different from other survival games but this aint it.

ITS A SCAM.

Boring, worse than DAYZ and The Day Before, terrible storage and UI system, failed to deliver on multiple road maps, I'm surprised this isn't even labelled as a scam seriously? It took you 4 years to add in Prone, PRONE ??? Let me guess it'll take you bloody 10 years to add in the "promised vehicles."

I'd recommend it for someone looking for a "DayZ/Scum lite" version that just want to loot and shoot a few things around an open world and move along without delving deep into the survival aspect these types of games go for with base building, stockpiling inventories, illness and metabolism management, etc.

I am a 44 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Halloween in 2020 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. We spent 4 hours on the game that night and we had killed the first 3 bosses. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

POORMAN'S Tarkov

Before deciding whether to dive into Deadside, it's crucial to note that the game was crafted by a small studio of five people. Drawing inspiration from titles like DayZ, Deadside delivers a familiar yet distinctive Zombie Survival experience, complete with loot, weapons, and engaging NPC encounters.

One of the game's standout features is its modest server capacity, capping at around 50 players. This limitation fosters a more intimate and focused environment, making player versus player (PVP) battles both enjoyable and engaging. While the missions lack the grandeur of a full-fledged campaign, they offer a fun co-op experience, especially when playing with newfound companions.

Connectivity-wise, my personal experience was smooth, thanks to a robust internet connection. However, it's worth mentioning that some players, particularly those with less reliable internet, reported issues like rubber banding. If you're in the latter category, it might be wise to approach Deadside cautiously, as connectivity issues could detract from the overall experience.

The arsenal in Deadside, while not overly intricate, provides the essentials for survival. From basic firearms like the AK to other distinct tools, the game delivers a satisfactory array of weaponry. Admittedly, the ADS (aiming down sights) mechanics feel a bit clunky, but this minor hiccup doesn't overshadow the overall enjoyment, especially for fans of the survival genre.

In essence, Deadside is a game that finds its strength in simplicity and the camaraderie of small-scale multiplayer interactions. If you've enjoyed titles like Rust, DayZ, or Scum, you'll likely find Deadside to be a welcoming addition to your collection. While it may not boast the complexity of larger productions, the game's charm lies in its modest scope, offering an entertaining space for zombie survival enthusiasts to explore and conquer together.

I think this game is really good as it stands and is easily worth the money the developers are asking for. However I do think its got a decent way to go before it becomes a proper finished survival game.

Now the main selling point to me with this game is it very similar to "DayZ" but without so much of the boring survival stuff.
This game offers a similar experience to "DayZ" but lets you get guns and gear fairly quickly with the added benefit of AI bots roaming around to keep things interesting along with being a source for loot. This game also had no zombies which is a plus for me as in my opinion "DayZ" zombies are terrible and something like "Scum" offers a better all round survival experience when compared to "DayZ".

Now in terms of improvements I think the missions really need improving with more variety. Basically the missions as they stand is go into an area and kill all the bots to get a reward. While I think this is a good starting point it gets boring fast in my opinion. The convoys were a cool idea but I find nobody bothers to try and steal the loot therefore it doesn't work too great in practice. Perhaps adding objectives to some of the missions making them harder would work better if done properly. Also i'm not a fan of the re-spawn system. Basically when you die you can choose which town you want to spawn in which means when you kill a player they just spawn 100m or so away and instantly come back. I would much prefer random IMO.

Okay some others things I would like to see to make this the perfect game is more points of interest in the current map ( Not expanding as the map has plenty of free space at the moment ). Making cities and towns more useful such as adding a police station and hospital as a place for basic guns, armour and an easy way to get medical supplies which is very difficult ATM. Also perhaps having an NPC which gives some basic quests for money or items would be cool. An example of a quest could be go to "Stepnoe" find a golden watch and bring it back here. This would also promote going to towns and cities along with increasing PVP in these areas. Some sort of weather system would also be greatly practised adding much variety and sounds to the environment making it feel more real and immersive.

Anyway thanks for reading this lengthy recommendation / review for this game.

The game itself seems okay at first, then quickly becomes tedious. It's also very buggy - disappearing loot, weapons not firing, floating assets etc. Events can spawn instantaneously on top of your character, insta-kill you and prevent you from reaching the loot it took hours to grind before it despawns.

In order to give it a fair chance, some friends and I rented a private server to see if it would help with some of these issues. The server setting options are few and not helpful and we still experienced lags and crashes.

All this aside and the fact this an early access game means most of this could be forgiven or even expected.  But after reading through the game's FAQ, I'm unimpressed with the developers. Not only is there no female character models in the entire game, the developers are quite flippant toward adding any. From the FAQ: “A: The gameplay itself implies having a lot of different clothing and equipment for characters. If we add the new type of character the amount of these items will increase accordingly and we will need to create them too. Such usage of the human resources will be counter productive for current stage of the game development.”

Enveloped in the intense vibes of Escape from Tarkov, DayZ, and Rust, Deadside has become a thrilling amalgamation of survival elements. From heart-pounding combat reminiscent of Tarkov to the rustic charm of boat rides akin to Rust, the game offers a unique and captivating experience.

Deadside has kept me engaged for 10 hours straight. The rollercoaster of emotions, from uncertain gunfights to the joy of finding valuable loot, has left me genuinely hooked.

In a gaming landscape where burnout is a challenge, Deadside stands out. Though it's not perfect, acknowledging its cons, the overall experience is commendable. I invested in the support pack to show my belief in the game's potential. Deadside's spark hints at future greatness, making it a standout title in the saturated gaming market. Kudos to the developers for their work, and I eagerly anticipate the game's continued success. Keep up the stellar work!

Been playing off and on since early access came out back in April of 2020. This game has so much potential its crazy. However, the devs for whatever reason are more focused on adding little things that doesn't matter at this point in time such as wolves, roe deer, and changing how the weapons look rather than making and adding changes where they are needed. 

The dev team is very small but come on, there's early access games out there with only one guy, and those are going in a better direction than deadside. I will say this, is deadside fun and enjoyable? Yes, it is. I wouldn't have put over 600+ hours into it or make content on it if I didn't enjoy the game for what it is. But that's what you have to keep in mind. For what it is.

A lot of people would say Deadside is a dead game. When in reality its not. A "dead game" has less than a 1,000 players playing and doesn't get any new content or updates. Although the player base is normally under 1,000 at the moment, it does get new content and updates often. Deadside isn't popular by any means but it isn't dead. You can still find public and private servers that have good pop to play on.

Lastly, would I recommend Deadside? Yes and No. Yes because everyone can have an enjoyable time in game. And No because once you get to "end game" in deadside there's really nothing left to do but PVP. Though PVP is fun, it can get really boring if that's all that left to do. Especially when you have people playing on a server who are new going up against people who have hundreds and thousands of hours in game. At that point you've just got to roll with the punches. It is what it is.

After slightly more than 5 hours into the game i feel like i have done just about everything this game has to offer, i built a base i ran around to do missions and loot up some gear, i also got a few air drops and did some PVP. No i have not got a boat but i don't know what the point is to have one other than to just duck hunt or fish. I have also been to both trader towns to do some trading. I have not been around the whole map yet but i am not thinking there will be anything new to offer in a different location than what i have already done. My biggest issue with this game is that it is labeled as a survival game yet the only survival mechanics in the game from what i noticed is a hunger/thirst system, there is no other survival mechanics/systems to the game at all, no weather system in the game so there is no hot or cold system there is also no stamina system either so you can just sprint forever with out needing to rest. There is rivers/lakes in the game but you are only allowed to fill up water containers at wells that you find around the map if they have water in them. There are things that you can interact with in the environment but it is very limited, like if you go in a house to look for loot you can not look through cabinets or in a dresser or even a fridge like you can in scum, so if you find loot in a house or any building it will be on the floor or on a table or something, there is only 1 type of static crate that you can loot from that i noticed. For a game that is labeled as a survival game it sure is lacking majorly in that category. The gun play in this game is not the best as it can feel a bit off and take getting use to. Speaking of guns it seems pretty lacking in verity, you got smgs rifles shotguns and snipers along with handguns, i did not notice any other gun types.There is wild life in this game but it is very limited, there is only deer wolfs ducks and fish, but the wolfs give no meat only fur. I am well aware this is a early access game but i mean come on this game has been out since 2020 and this is all the game has so far, i don't know i feel like it should have a lot more to offer than what it currently does. I guess if you can get the game on sale and you have a friend to play it with then sure it may keep you invested for a little while since there is PVP but honestly i think that is all this game has going for it, if there was no PVP i really truly think this game would be completely dead.



UPDATE: I recently explored more of the map and found and drove 2 types of boats, The boats are really not that great and mostly used for fishing. There are larger towns on the map that you can go to and look around for loot but it does not seem to differ from loot that i can find in a house, meaning i do not think there is better loot to be found in specific locations i am pretty sure you can find any kind of loot anywhere on the map as it feels like it is just RNG based loot spawns. Community wise for the game can of course be toxic but if you get on a good server that has active admins that actually enforce the rules it helps with the toxic behavior. I found it very odd that there is still not land based vehicles in this game yet there are boats, You also can not lay prone either all you can do is stand or crouch. Again as i have stated this is a VERY shallow game when it comes to things that can be done. Before i sum up here i want to talk about the AI's behavior, There are missions that you can do in the game that range in difficulty, the easy to mid range difficulty missions are not to hard to do because the AI that are at them missions are pretty stupid and easy to kill, BUT the harder missions the AI are actually on crack or something because they will just instantly 1 shot you in the head from a crazy far range like 100+meters away. This feel extremely unbalanced and near impossible do go up against, it makes me feel like i am going up against cheaters. The worst thing about this is that you have to do missions to get the better gear and obviously the harder missions are going to have higher tear gear, yes i guess you could get the better gear by killing a player that maybe has some but it would be nice if i could get it another way without having to worry about getting absolutely destroyed by cracked out AI, before you go and think to yourself skill issue, go try it out yourself then and see how you do. Overall there is a solid foundation here but it needs A LOT of work and tweaks done.
A Lot of potential, I just wish they would add a damn car/truck instead of wildlife and expand on the building mechanics of the game. Still a fantastic game thus far...
This game sucks. Bots are super snipers and need re-balanced. Wasted my time and money.

I write this now after theyve done way more updates and... not much has changed. Devs dont listen to players at all, latest handful of updates added; ducks, wolves, and deer. Exactly what you want in a pvp/pve game right? Player count tells it all. (theres barely any player count even at peak)

I think this game is really good as it stands and is easily worth the money the devs are asking for. However I do think its got a decent way to go before it becomes a proper finished survival game.

Now the main selling point to me with this game is it very similar to "DayZ" but without so much of the boring survival stuff. 
This game offers a similar experience to "DayZ" but lets you get guns and gear fairly quickly with the added benefit of AI bots roaming around to keep things interesting along with being a source for loot. This game also had no zombies which is a plus for me as in my opinion "DayZ" zombies are terrible and something like "Scum" offers a better all round survival experience when compared to "DayZ".

Now in terms of improvements I think the missions really need improving with more variety. Basically the missions as they stand is go into an area and kill all the bots to get a reward. While I think this is a good starting point it gets boring fast in my opinion. The convoys were a cool idea but I find nobody bothers to try and steal the loot therefore it doesn't work too great in practice. Perhaps adding objectives to some of the missions making them harder would work better if done properly. Also im not a fan of the respawn system. Basically when you die you can choose which town you want to spawn in which means when you kill a player they just spawn 100m or so away and instantly come back. I would much prefer random imo. 

Okay some others things I would like to see to make this the perfect game is more points of interest in the current map ( Not expanding as the map has plenty of free space at the moment ). Making cities and towns more useful such as adding a police station and hospital as a place for basic guns, armour and an easy way to get medical supplies which is very difficult atm. Also perhaps having an NPC which gives some basic quests for money or items would be cool. An example of a quest could be goto "Stepnoe" find a golden watch and bring it back here. This would also promote going to towns and cities along with increasing PVP in these areas. Some sort of weather system would also be greatly practised adding much variety and sounds to the environment making it feel more real and immersive.

Anyway thanks for reading this lengthy recommendation / review for this game.

Overall if you like the look of the game just buy it.

Fun Survival / modern pvp/Pve  game with a large map and plenty of towns villages to loot. they have boats that need fuel around the water ways, however not enough spawn in ... and i find myself playing running simulator a lot. however at least there is a treasure hunting you can do along the way. 
I feel if they keep bringing content to the game it so far is worth the 26 bucks or w/e it is. the AI can be a little snap-shots at times with a pistol from 300 yards away somehow... lol  but it is still fun.  with they had ATV's or something to get places on land faster..

I purchased this game & supporter pack in the recent Black Friday sale & i honestly would not have minded paying the full price! I have not stopped playing this game since & don't intend on stopping anytime soon!
This game feels like a combination of Rust, DayZ & Tarkov but with alot of Stalker elements! A hardcore survival that truly lives up to its description! 
The World & atmosphere is absolutely beautiful, It is currently in Early Access but already feels like a polished game! Each region & little town you go to certainly feels different from the last & each time town feels like they have their own little story of what happened there, from major apartment complexes to tiny little farms & factories. The landscape is truly wonderful & planned out very carefully! The map is also very huge! i have yet to explore so much of it but i am in love with the current towns i have already visited. Vehicles are yet to be added but when they do it will truly change the game for the better!
The AI in the game are very fun to hunt down, some will walk in pairs, some in bigger groups. Some will camp out in houses, rooftops & sheds & others will just straight up hunt you! They range from being very dumb to CSS bot instakill tier, which personally i hope receive some tweaks in the near future. The missions in the game are very fun & are always a new challenge. There are PvE & PVP servers available which throws a whole new challenge into the mix!
The Base building at the moment is very clean & i like it alot! Although you do have to sacrifice one of your main weapons to wield the axe as there is no storage option for rifles, the devs are currently working on multi space storage slots. It can feel abit grindy during building your base but definitely mix it up with missions & random looting so you don't burn yourself out, trust me. 
The food system is very nice! tinned food & goodies are scattered throughout the world & the metres do not deplete at an extremely annoying rate such as other games, so eating & drinking can become stressful but its actually kind of rare, i like it! although there is no cheeki breeki vodka drinking just yet!
The combat system is very smooth! Guns look amazing, the recoil & control of weapons is very slick & the felling of getting a kill or headshot is so satisfying! the ragdolls are pretty nice too! Theres too many guns to name & they can all be modified with Scopes, Silencers, Mags & Flashlights! 
This game is already so good with what has been done & can only get better from here on! The devs recently got a major funding boost so there's no doubt we will see more content added soon! If you're a fan of any of the games mentioned above there's no doubt you will enjoy this game! Highly Recommend!

..But of course not everything is great, here are a list of Cons I personally have come across or not a fan of that others might agree with, but don't let this be the decider of your purchase!
- The AI in Epic Missions & Helicrashes are far too OP on their aiming & Damage, always a 1 hit instakill before you even see them or when they pop around a corner, Not all the bots are like this, but there's sometimes just that one that is sick of humans
- In Base Building, the land claim can become frustrating to place as the requirements are too high valued, you cannot build near buildings, other player bases, roads, train tracks etc. so you can be out in the middle of nowhere & go to place your claim but i tiny little shack could be nearby blocking you from that with nothing else around for miles. kinda annoying.
- Trees don't disappear when collecting wood, you can build your whole base & more from one tree. If a Runescape sort of regen timer was implemented that would be kinda cool & add to the realism
- The inventory slots & what you can & cant hold at times is annoying but this will be fixed/updated
- The Safe Zones & traders feel very empty, i feel like they should split the roles up to make it more populated, such as a medic to sell the medical items, A vendor for strictly food, a Tradesman for all base building & split the gun dealer with a clothier for all clothes, instead of just having the two for everything.
- Although i do not mind walking in games, There is going to be ALOT of walking & running in this game until vehicles are added. 
- At this stage there is a little bit of lack of content, but this is purely because its early access. There are missions consisting of Easy, Medium, Hard & Epic Tier, Convoy missions where you have to take out the boss & his guards to retrieve a briefcase, Helicopter Crashes & airdrops of random High Tier loot, which are heavily sought after on PvP server. I haven't gotten bored yet with all these missions but some people have & might.
- Lack of Online players! So come join us! On the Official Australia server i play the most people I've seen on is around 11-13 people, on average around 3-6. Alot of people complain of this but there's only one way to change that! The Bots are always on & shooting when everyone leaves!

So yeah they're all the cons I've come across, & with a bit of time they can all be easily fixed!
Again, I highly recommend Deadside to anyone!
In terms of performance,In the 28 hours I've played as of this review i have not experienced a single crash or technical issue. I'm Running an i7 2600 @ 3.4, 8gb of Ram & an AMD R9

***Review updates 21/11/23***

Sadly i cannot recommend this game still.  Little to no progress given the length of time in development and no effort to turn things around at a reasonable pace to draw in a bigger and better player base.

-The map is fairly small and empty although the game is a walking/running simulator with only very small towns/locations of interest.
-Little added in variation with weapons and these dont even seem fun.
-The missions are boring and always take place in the same industrial places.  Just 2 primary military locations to loot.  *more locations added but still the same rinse and repeat copy and paste mess*
-Gun play is a little ropey at times and scope drift/shake without the ability to hold breath using sniper rifles is frustrating.  *gunplay still remains bad*
-With the exception of killing AI and players there is little to do, even looting/running to the trader to sell/buy gets repetitive.  Missions are just uninteresting.
-The addition of boats as a form of travel was pointless, you still find yourself running for miles.  
-Base building is extremely basic and there is currently no way to raid/breach bases.  *Still basic even after several major updates*
-Server performance seems atrocious when playing on servers with over 35 players.  *Still the same poor performance*
-Locked to a single server host G-Portal and they aren't the best for server hosting.  *still remains the same and i suspect their servers are of poor performance quality of severely over allocated*

As usual with games like this cheating and toxicity is rampant.  *Toxic chat in game seems much worst, the worst part of this was for me that some of these individuals seem like mature gamers given their time on steam vs playtime*

Before I said the future potential was possibly there, given the lack of progress and development this will remain dying a slow death and I dont see the developer making improvements anytime soon.  The game still makes for a frustrating and boring mess and I dont have confidence in things changing.

There are better games like scum and 7 days to die. This game is more of a proof of concept rather than a fun game, and I would go as far as recommending Rust over this game. 

Do not buy, even on discount. Especially if you do not have friends to play this game with.

The AI are pretty annoying. Their detection radius is too large, they can see you a mile away. The servers are always empty, and the people who are on join PvE only servers like cowards because they don't want to fight other players and lose their stuff. Every building you loot has the same guns and the big apartment buildings lack any loot at all except for the 3 AI camping on the roof. Something really annoying is needing to find water and every well on the map is "dried up". Why put wells in your game to save players from dehydration if you can't drink from any of them? Something that's useful in PvE only lobbies is being able to choose your spawn when you die so you can run back for loot, but it is completely unfair in PvP lobbies. I'll give the devs this tho, the graphics and map are pretty nice. If you're looking for a PvP survival game like DayZ look elsewhere, none of the 15 people in your region playing at all times joins the PvP/PvE servers.
obviously there is still a couple things to work on, but otherwise, its genuinely fun from time to time to hop on and play out a wipe, definitely worth the money.

Game was alright around 2020-2021 but I've come back and it's all fucked

Economy is broken, weapons and armour are about 1/5th of the old price where as ammo, medicine and food is more than 10x the old amount in some cases. I feel like they shifted from mostly combat focused to survival focused. 

Used to be able to keep hydration up by drinking soda which replenished ~50/100 iirc, soda is the only hydration the traders sell and not only has it gone up in price but now it only replenishes 20. Apart from the coca cola you can use the flask that you spawn with but the issue is you can't fill it up at rivers and of the 6 wells I went to only 1 was able to fill the flask up to just 60%. The only reliable source of water is a water collector which you can only make inside a base (I cbf going over how atrocious the base building is). 

The AI still shoot at you though bushes and will stay aggro for over 250m through walls and whatnot. They can still hit you accurately from hundreds of metres while constantly side strafing which would be fine if you could do the same but good luck with how fucked the sway is. Shoot one and every other bot will spin on your ass and light you up with scorps or Ak74s. If you think Tarkov AI is bullshit then this game will enrage every brain cell in your head. 

The spawning system is more forgiving and being able to fast travel between the two safe zones (for only 3 dogtags) is really convenient. However the addition of wolves has ruined this experience because they don't make any noise until they are already within 20m sprinting at you. Pretty much always get attacked by at least 1 when running back to my old corpse which guarantees you'll be at 3/4 health or lower everytime before you stab em with the spawn knife. Unlike actual wolves they hunt alone and are not scared of gunfire in anyway (I think they actively run towards it). They never attack the AI scavs or soldiers and will still run up on you while there are bullets whizzing around left, right and centre - fuckin nuisances.

Gunplay has improved but is by no means flawless and the amount of times you will cancel the reload by sprinting too early is infuriating. Your character can put in a new mag and cock the gun and it will still make you restart if you do anything in the ~half a second between your bolt going forward and the animation actually completing. Sway is horrid and hold breath bugs out by sometimes removing your ability to move the reticle - you will miss shots due to this so get used to the sway. 

Servers are by no means dead, just injured. Americans and Europeans will be fine but I played for 8 hours straight and didn't see a single Australian or Asian server with more then 5 people. All up I'd say if your coming for the PVPVE just play tarkov, if your coming for the hunting and survival play Call of the Wild, and if you want a bit of both with some less scuffed base building then hop on DayZ because at least the Zombos can't spinbot you.
