I've played Scum, DayZ, Rust, I find Deadside, more entertaining then them all. Deadside has AI that roam around in groups, so it gives you stuff to fight, that isnt PVP. Of course, any player could hear your gunshots while fighting bots, try to ambush you, that hasnt happened to me as of yet. There's missions around the map, where you can obtain better gear and money. I find that I dont suffer from "gear fear" in Deadside like i do in Scum, or Dayz. For this reason alone, it makes the game so much more enjoyable. I am much more likely to engage in PVP, than in any of those games. Theres a respawn system that allows you to spawn in different places, I like this, but dont at the same time, i dont like it. Ive always loved how in Dayz, you spawn on the south coast as a new spawn. It makes creates an interesting kind of dynamic where the farther north, into chernarus you go, the more likely you'll run into geared players(at least on official servers)meaning you have to travel quite far, and work your way up to good gear. In deadside acquisition of gear is much easier, majority of players you run into, will be geared. Also, the traders is cool, but people always wait at the border of the safezone, to ambush people as they come out, and thats F*cked imo. Had some dudes that wouldnt stop following me around and harassing me, so i just had to leave the servers. othern than that kind of thing happening with other players, its a great up and coming, survival FPS. I get good kicks out of fighting the AI. The AI is vastly improved since the last time I played. They used to just run at you in a straight line, now they actually manuever, in ways that make you quesion if your fighting other players, or the AI. They will do things like crouch and try to sneak up on you, if you are in a room, and they know where your at. Like they do things that make you question if your fighting a real player. Thats what makes this game great.

Since i love survival and post apocalyptic games with a passion i had to get this game. First time i loaded in i tried to do a sick play by immediately heading to an event to try and get some starting loot off fighting players like other survival games and it turns out there were no players. Instead there were around 15 bots that bloody smoked me. an encounter where it was only bots/NPC's wasn't what i was expecting but that's just life. i remember respawning in a building, outside the building i hear an AK-47 going crazy outside so i do what any sane human would do and i pick up an axe to rush the shooter and i'm not even joking when i say i ran up to him, hit him once with an axe, and he died. i was shocked. so i took the AK and went to the same event where i got smoked by bots and killed everyone there and got all the loot. definitely one of my greatest starting experiences on any survival game. just wanted to start with that anecdote of mine. so the gunplay in this is fairly good i reckon same with the graphics. the map is bloody massive not as big as DayZ but still massive. the world can feel kinda empty at times but they added a cool feature where NPC patrols walk through towns which you can fight if you'd like to. the survival aspect isn't very heavy in this. you can get shot heaps then just consume bandages, your guns and clothes don't degrade and all you need to worry about is food and drinks. it feels like a game where you run around, loot average loot from buildings (you will want to go to events) shoot npcs, rarely encounter players since playerbase is lowkey dead. and repeat. the AI is kinda silly in this, the NPC's will just walk up to you and open fire sometimes if they can't get a shot on you which results in their death since they're point blank and they often just stand fully still which is an easy kill. sometimes i get crazy frame rate glitches too, that's all i can really think of. if you are looking for a survival game like DayZ and stuff maybe don't get this. it would be better if it was more popular. i don't mind playing this every now and then though.

As a long time survival fps player, a dad and a full time worker this game gives me the DayZ lite feel. I mean this as a compliment of course!

Deadside gives me the ability to jump on for an hour or so when i get chance and pick up from where I left off, having journeys around finding loot, intense gun fights (admittedly I'm no sharpshooter) and enough of a light survival element to keep me entertained. This is early access and the map could do with fleshing out a bit more, but as for now it keeps me happy.

Generally I'd advise looking up footage of this on YT or something to get the feel for it, the best way to describe this game would be DayZ Lite Edition with bots instead of zombies, the environments are clearly inspired by DayZ and eastern europe but I'm fine with that. In fact I quite like it.

Build a base or don't, having player storage helps players with limited time, such as myself, however I would state that if you just buy the game, then don't expect much in terms of storage, I've brought the supporter pack just so I can have more storage as I doubt I'll ever build a base in this game (I just lack the time)...I don't fancy building a base i can only protect from players once a week, it'd just be raid bait.

You'll find yourself going from easy missions to the harder ones in due course, took me a while to muster the courage for a harder mission.

All in all a solid game and I look forward to what this game will become over time.

Amazing survival game.

Casual / PVP action focused survival game. With Ai patrols and missions to challenge your PvE skills.

Basic gear is very simple to get. So you can always get back into the action even if you lose everything. The missions offer a gear stepping stone from basic civilian gear to starting military gear.  

The new overhaul to the spawning system makes the pvp much more enjoyable. If you get in some intense action the fight isn't simply over because you killed the enemy player. You have a chance to make it back to a body get a gun and jump back in to.

The fun I have been having with this game has drastically increased with the past few patched. The development is definitely going in the correct direction!!

Some negatives would be the lack of vehicles and how dense the world is. Some areas feel quite empty. Some fields could definitely use a few more rocks and or static cover of some sort. This is really noticeable when setting up ambushes for case carriers and such. When you engage in longer range pvp fights you begin to notice how much just open fields there are. 

When walking on a 45 angle if you turn you mouse to look left or right the animations kind of overlap causing you to stop walking for a millisecond which feels pretty junk.

All the negatives I mentioned are listed on the road map for this year however.

Well worth the cost they are asking.

I've had this game in my library for awhile, decided to give it go. If I had to sum it up it feels like Tarkov-lite. I don't mean this with any negative connotation either. Even being in beta it's pretty fun. I haven't scratched the surface as I've only about 4 hours in, but there's base building, trading, scavenging, etc. The enemy AI is probably the weakest aspect so far. They can hit you from quite a distance away with accuracy, they seem to swarm your location from any nearby area, but you can always cheese it out by hiding in a building or a shipping container shooting them as they come in the door lol.

The graphics are good. I'm playing on an RX 5500 XT 4GB with maxed settings at 1080p and getting very high frame rates. I have an older card, so anything newer should give you even better performace. There are some hiccups that rear their heads every now and then like dropping to 20-30 FPS for a second or two. Nothing I'd say is game breaking.

Like I said, overall I'm very impressed with Dead Side, even in it's current state is very playable. If you're looking for something similar to Escape From Tarkov, but not as punishing, this quite possibly could be it.

I'll get the main negatives out of the way first:
i. Yes, it's a running simulator
ii. It's probably not fun without friends, you'll struggle to maintain interest in this game solo
iii. The game might feel clunky at times especially at the start until you get a grip on the movement, mechanics etc.
iv. You're guaranteed to be frustrated by the bots at times

Dedside isn't a game for everyone. It's punishing, it takes time, it has a steep learning curve and it often might turn into a frustrating experience, the playerbase is a little small and the updates come slow and the game might feel that it's lacking content.

However it can be amazingly rewarding, nothing feels as good as returning to the safezone filled with loot (for us rats) to sell/stash, or hitting a godly snipe or outplaying someone and telling him to go touch grass. Your base will never be raided offline and once you learn how to move in this game it'll open up your horizons for many plays and things to do. PvE servers can be good to learn the game, try gear, exprience with base building but eventually i'd recommend trying PvP. Having a squad or meeting people and joining one enhances the experience by a lot and it's really recommended if not required in order to ensure your survival. The game offers decent accommodation to suit many playstyles (even tho sniping is kinda dominant as of right now).

Even if you eventually get tired of the game you can always come back when big updates drop and have some fun. The potential is undeniable and i'd say it's worth a shot to play this game. Deadside has interesting takes in the respawn, base raiding and NPC/AI system and it woult be nice to see them expanded/tinkered with further. Experiencing and learning about stuff for the 1st time is an unforgettable time and it feels really satisfying and fun. Hopefully the game will pick up and become more active and more private communities with rules (against safezone camping, creative events etc) will appear.

pretty fun to play. kind of like dayz (with no zombies) and rust with a dash of tarkov.  the AI are pretty tough and the PVP is fun.  in another 6 months or so of writing this they should have a major update which will help with content and optimization.  i'd recommend to a friend for sure.

Alright, Deadside is a solid mid-tier for me. This game has some very obvious flaws, one of them being player to land ratio. You can play for some solid time and not meet another person, not counting AIs. Another being transportation, the map is massive and there's no cars, trains, planes, etc. to get around with. This makes travelling long distances a pain, it also makes people stay close to the safe zones which means other parts of the map are just vacant. Another flaw is that there isn't much loot, it takes some serious time to get some decent loot, not to mention keeping it for a longer period of time. There's a lot of flaws but the dev team seems to be working on fixes and such, although I think the biggest flaws are at the base of the game. Solid 4/10.

A very nice blend of different elements of already established survival shooter games. 
I would describe it as a mix of DayZ, Rust and Tarkov, in some regards with a more casual approach (which isn't bad at all). 
If the devs keep the pace of updates going and keep listening to their community the potential of this already very stable foundation is very promising. 
I felt after 10 hours of playing the price already was worth the experience. Needless to say I was happy to sink in even a few more hours ;)

The game is Pre-Alpha and I understand that it has much room to grow, however:
It's a PUBG clone that has added base building elements. 
After 7 hours of grinding dying and losing all progress without being able to explore those elements, I have lost interest in continuing the game. 
The PVE combat is annoying. While enemies are easy to kill, they manage to land god shots leaving you running several klicks to hopefully reclaim your items so long as you survive the ambush that's waiting.
I never got to experience the base building aspect because above, and never finding resources/ having inventory space to do so.
You have to make a choice between building a FOB or aquiring enough equipment to survive the "Scavs"
I never attempted the PVP element because I wanted to run some relaxed servers to learn the game before branching into that.
Speaking of servers, most have very few players. I have never seen more than 10 players on a server. good or bad you decide.
Personally I believe the designers were attempting to frankenstein PUBG, Escape from Tarkov and fortnight into a hardcore extreme survival. they succeeded in creating a monster. 
If extreme grinding and dumb difficulty is your forte than I recommend the game.
If you dislike a running simulator where AI will kill you from random places than I don't recommend it.
Very fun game and hopefully the Devs will continue to improve

This is a great game -  and this is from someone who HATES DayZ and Miscreated. I absolutely love Deadside however.

Don't listen to the negative reviews.  Most of these are posted by people who didn't put in the time to learn the game or aren't running the proper connection/system to handle the game.  I Strongly recommend a PVE server to start,  and learn the mechanics.  It may seem like its just a "grab a gun and go PVP" game, but it isn't. 

As far as system performance, I have no idea what people are complaining about.  I have my own server, and play on 3 others.  I never lag,  on any server populated or not.  I can only guess, people aren't running a solid connection,  or are on a sub-par machine or both.  The most that's happen to me is I have been disconnected occasionally, but was always able to log right back in without any loss. 

Take the time to learn what the gear does for you,  armor helps a ton against AI and players, guns have vastly different performances and the different gun mobs change the performance even further.  You want certain equipment for certain types of missions etc.  

Learn the AI -  Military AI is MUCH more dangerous than regular scavengers, and their aim is WAY better shocking I know. Some AI will chase you down, and can camp your corpse making getting your stuff back harder.  Learn how base Spawns work,  learn how the respawning device works,  Learn how to drop boxes to store gear to come back and get to sell or use later.  

If you play for an hour on a PVP server,  die 30 times,  then post a rant and demand a refund,  well .....   that's more about you and not the game.  


If your going to rate the game,  at least do it after having actually experienced ALL of the game.

In it's current state, it's a bit barebones, but the skeleton looks really good and promising. It plays similar to a modded DayZ server, with a slightly more "arcade-y" feel to it. The gunplay is nice and fast-paced, the building is (relative to DayZ) pretty simple and intuitive, and building materials are much easier to gather. The safe zones provide just enough to be a nice little loot locker and places to refill on necessities, without giving you access to too much loot, so you still need to go out and earn the good stuff yourself. The missions are a good idea and are executed well. And the raiding system is something that I, as a somewhat regular rust player, am quite a fan of. They heavily attempt to combat offline raiding. When you kill a player, and that player has a base, there's a chance they drop a "Raid Token", which allows you to initiate a raid event on their base, and this event enables structure damage on what they've built, as well as the ability to loot the storage boxes within their base. Though, keep in mind, if a player has your raid token, they can initiate the raid whether you are online or not.

I'm quite a fan of how it's shaping up. It currently lacks vehicles, which I'm sure are going to be added at some point in the future, and the game would benefit from it immensely, in my opinion. Also, some form of visible/interact-able wildlife would do wonders for the game world. It can feel a little dead in the runs between places. You can hear birds, though you can't see any, and there are no animals roaming around in the woods, like elk or deer.

My only gripe really (and it's a small one) is that the AI can be a bit strange to deal with. Sometimes they'll just sit there and die to your weak little pistol, and other times they'll be certified snipers that will OHK you from hundreds of meters away. If they were a little more interesting to deal with, without feeling like you're getting BS'd from aimbot, I think they'd be a really cool little map hazard. Right now, they're mostly just inconveniences in between you and loot.

Right now, I'd recommend at its current price point of $20USD. I imagine that price point will go up as more content is added, rightfully so. As it stands, it's a good break from the hardcore nature of DayZ or Tarkov and serves as a refreshing alternative to both.

The Game is pretty good, but i can become even better. With all the recent news about new stuff coming, im back at it again.
Despite its few shortcomings, it can be fun, if you accept the few downs you will encounter in any PvP game, where you can loose a lot of stuff after beeing killed by somebody else, but really, thats just like real life, isnt it?
But scavenging the Map, and slowly getting better and better gear and weapons feels so good, and is the fun part. Killing with these weapons is even more fun, and can feel so good, even because it is quite challenging, depending on the situation.
Meeting a lost NPC Scav patrol in the open, is completely different than accidentaly coming over a high tier Military Convoy. But with greater challenge, of course comes greater reward. Much, much greater reward.  

I personally like the Base Building, even if I would love to see it beeing expanded. Things like furniture or decorations to make your base unique would make this game close to perfect for me.

The game looks prettier than ever, despite some graphical limitations. The lighting in peticular is so firicking good, and the sun light is so cinematic, it makes me wanna stand there and just watch, and completely forget about the guy hunting my freshspawned Ass, after my third attempt at getting back my first corpse with the good stuff.

The community differs from server to server, but in the end, its a PvP game, so ... DONT ... TRUST .... ANYONE.
Beeeing killed by someone you gave some leftover bandages in the safe zone, just 10 min ago can feel like betrayel, but a lot of times its not out of spite, but out of panic. Shoot first, or risk getting shot yourself. But if your lucky you can actually meet nice people, and even work together in a squad. 

Overall good game,
and now, with a second, new studio to support it, and a somewhat frequent update scedule, im thrilled to see where this game will go. 
You can buy it now, or wait till theres even more content, but i suggest giving it a try.

The game shows a lot of promise, most of my nitpicks come from mechanics that you feel should be in a game like this, like prone movement and not clunky inventory management. I love the inertia of the character and the bots help spice up the encounters. Guns feel good but sound could be improved upon, specially foliage. Kinda annoying that you can't carry a knife and a pistol at the same time due to the item slot designated purpose.

Overall it's pretty good, the player base is stable if you check the charts as of March 2022 and no doubt that if the game keeps getting updates with both content and perfomance improvement (which to me it hasn't been an issue, yet) this could be a great game given a few years

The game has some things going for it but overall it is unoriginal, slow paced, and difficult in an annoying but not challenging way. Most missions and POIs are far away, and you spawn far from where you died. This is made worse because the of the players slow running, boringly dead world. There are no plants or animals that can be harvested and the even in towns the only encounters are generic groups of 3-4 gun men. Combat with said gun men is annoying and unfun. To name a few issues enemy hit boxes are tiny, enemies blend in well, enemies take far to many shots to kill, and enemies have absurd aim. I understand the game is meant to be "hardcore" but I will never enjoy a game where i am jumped by bullet sponge, aimbots with automatic weapons, just to die and run for 30 minutes to get my stuff back. In conclusion, to make this game fun is possible but it would take some large changes that i doubt the devs will make. 4/10

I would like to see this game grow, while also making the difficulty of the game much harder. Currently, the majority of the game is PVE loot farming which is far too easy, frequent, and consistent in giving you rare and good loot. I think loot should be slightly harder to acquire, especially the "heavy" and military gear. Nametags (team IDs that float above you and your squads' heads) should also be removed from the game as it would discourage playing in large groups or roaming with large groups. I would also like to see that this game wipes bi-monthly at least, preferably monthly. This will give new life to the game as early-game combat is very fun and intense whereas late-game combat is stupid as everyone is using 1-2 hit kill weapons. There is nothing wrong with the weapons themselves, but when this kind of PVP is commonplace as opposed to rare, the game gets kind of stale, as loot hoarding is rampant. Also please add weapon and armor durability. I would love to see more early and middle-tier PVP. Please make PVE events rarer and less farmable. I would love to see base raiding made even more commonplace for some intense and high-stakes PVP and allows for players to feel vulnerable about their loot (maybe make the raid token 100% drop?). I want loot to mean something, not just be farmable or commonplace. Otherwise, this game is VERY fun but I can tell it has a ways to go. In the future, I would hope to see a larger map, more players per server, vehicles, new events, vendor missions, new loot (including armors and weapons), and so on. I wish this game will veer away from being too fast-paced while still retaining the very engaging gun-play that it currently has. The community is super nice and like no other out there. In most survival games if I make a play on someone I would expect to be called a slur, in Deadside it's gg's all around. Of course, there are still some shitters, but for the most part, these gamers are some cool folks.

In summary, very fun, a bit too easy, please make raiding common, and make loot a little bit harder. Lots of fun fast-paced gunplay and a very nice community. I recommend.

A pretty decent survival multiplayer game that has a Tarkov and DayZ mesh feel to it. The game now is finally getting pretty decent updates every month and is on track to be a good game. The game however in its current state still has a bunch of bugs, the weapons needs to be balanced quite a good amount, the way gunfights are done need to be severely updated and made more smooth and clean, it feels quite chunky at the moment. The AI needs to be toned way down as they are always in groups and when you pop a shot off, all of them open up immediately and you instantly die. Gear needs to be reworked as well as armor isn't very well polished. The game though has a lot of potential, map is huge and new areas are constantly getting added, the bunker system is pretty neat and you can build a base and raid bases. Vehicles are getting added in and there are map events that happen like airdrops, convoys and helo crashes that offer players a chance at good gear. The cosmetics like weapon skins and armor permutations could use some hard work as they look horrendous like someone bought a skin off a 5 year old's Etsy shop. I would recommend everyone to give this a good try and stick through the games development phase as this game has serious potential.

This game brings back the feeling of playing legacy Rust, but polished and more combat driven. The gunplay is solid and the incentive to compete for events is rewarding. I'm really enjoying the direction this game is headed.

I play solo on every game I play, and usually PVE.  So, my opinion is based on that.  I have built my basic 1x2 on a favorite PVE server where the availability of guns is somewhat boosted, and I use these exclusively for hunting bots.  I find the bots to have varied levels of skill, and the locations for the higher level bots to be obvious.  I've really enjoyed my limited time in-game.  There is much more for me to explore than I have time for.  I don't know or care to know that much about guns IRL, but the game experience here is that the guns do seem very realistic and varied.  Definitely recommended to play in a duo or better for most of the available activity.

The game world is breathtakingly beautiful and feels real. I grew up in an area that has similar geography and my raiding partner and I spot a lot of locations that look similar to places from our childhood.  The devs are working hard to add more locations to the existing area and to expand the playable area. A lot of players complain about the how much running you have to do. We usually engage autorun as we head to a location, make an attack plan and just joke around while browsing memes. I highly recommend playing this game with friends as the PvE is brutal and you'll need a low-skill meat shield on your team. The combat is challenging and raiding bunkers and doing hard missions requires patience and planning. We had our fair share of rage moments where the Bots locked onto our heads instantly, but we usually were able to laugh it off, get our stuff back, and try again. 

We play on a PvE server as it tends to be more relaxed. Players are friendly and easy going. Players will trade and share among each other at the safe zones or just give gear away to new players. Players on some servers will build crates in safe zones as a community swap. Take a penny, leave a penny so to speak. Safe zones are a great place to chat with other players, share stories, or troll if you really need to get that out of your system.

 The devs published a roadmap at the start of 2022 and have already pushed multiple updates since than. Deadside has an excellent foundation and I recommend this to players who like Tarkov, Dayz, Stalker etc. Deadside has a bright future and I'm looking forward to seeing what comes next.

For the moment, I've bean playing Deadside for maybe 20 hours (after spending over 5k hours in SCUM), and game doesnt look bad, few things I've would suggest/add to the game. Squads are dissbanded when you quit the game and enter it again, so every time you get in game again, you need to add ppl in squad to be able to recognize them. There is no prone option, you cant prone in game. I didnt notice difference between bulletproof wests, some cost more, and some less, but in the end you take loads of damage from "banana" weapons. I'll update more when i play it a lil bit longer. All in all, nice game with decent ammount of content. Oh yeah, vehicles would be nice ;)

EDIT:
After arround 80 hours in game.

Base building:
I like the idea of stacking foundations and base building is not bad, one issue is that if you dont have enough space in inventory you cant use items from vicinity, and that could be an problem, specially for new players.
Arround base barbed wire fence is disaster to line up, they dont snap at each other and if you don't have a team mate to check the sided if they line up, its really hard to possition them correctly. It would be nice to be able to snap them for better lineup.

SOUND:
One thing i hate in this game, and its footprints possition arround you, the same sound is if player is on the same floor with you or one floor below or above you, you cant be 100% sure where is he.

Final verdict:
Do not waste you money on this game (at least not for now). Official servers are full of cheaters, deadside community is the most toxic one ive seen so far, most of the players are kids with huge ego. Devs do not care much tbh, reporting cheaters doesnt do anything, eaven when loads of ppl report the same players. Game is buggy as hell, you often stuck on base doors, items dissapear, NPC-s are aiming like crazy and trough obsticles. There is a bug when you get killed you cant spawn any more, you just get stucked on "loading picture", restarting game, Steam or even computer doesnt do anything... All in all, DO NOT BUY THIS crapp... this is the shittiest "survival" game I've ever played. Only survival thing is this game is food and drink...

Whereas the game does not have any survival aspects at the moment, its PVE concept makes it enjoyable. I have a total of 36 hrs in the game and I believe I have already experienced the most stressful situations the game can make you feel. I have been killed by the AI using a pistol,  a fully gear squad doing an easy mission and a camper who is waiting for players to finish a specific mission, so he/she can steal the cargo.

My PVE experience has been a mixture of stress and entertainment since I honestly enjoy the hardcore aspects of the missions. There are three level of difficulties; easy, medium, hard and epic. The easy and medium missions can be completed by not using a sophisticated gear, while the hard and epic missions require a better gear and more skills since the AI uses better equipment to resist more and do more damage.  However, I believe the AI still needs some adjustments to allow players to complete the mission in a more tactical form. Sometimes the AI can hear you even when you are trying to complete the mission with a pistol using a suppressor. Besides, experience players have found different tricks that make the AI to be killed more easily. In fact, players can be behind a wall and be constantly picking the AI. 

The PVP aspects of Deadside are still very basic to what the game is designed to be. The PVP fights makes me feel as if I were playing PUBG. Its lack of realism allows players to perform irrational plays. Furthermore, I strongly believe that base building should not be implemented at this state since most of the players have made bases near either looting areas or where all the hard missions are located. The spawn system is another big issue that I have noticed during my game hours. It still needs to be adjusted to avoid infinite fights because players who have a base near the area of a certain mission can spawn back with full gear and kill you.

The shooting physics need to be more oriented to realism. I have constantly been killed by a camper using either a VSD or a mosin at more than 200 mts away. In fact, these two rifles can kill you with one shot at any part of the body, so the devs really have to add some changes to that. Moreover, the map looks as if it were designed for sniping only because most of the missions are located in open areas. 

In conclusion, the game looks very promising, but it still needs a lot of work since it has a lot of unbalances when it comes to PVP. I am hoping the devs fix the issues that I stated above and I am looking forward to keep playing this game in the future. Cheers <3.

I have had deadside since just after release and not much has changed. 
Theres a running joke among the very small player base that they should rename it to cross country running simulator 2020 because really theres only 5 hours of content but you spend 3 of that running across an empty map as there a no vehicles or transport. 
The raiding mechanic sucks, building is clunky.
They have put in some work over time but only some, most of which has been spent fixing bugs that made it nearly unplayable early (weird aim jitters, bad hit reg, bad AI), all that has taken 2 years though which speaks to a larger problem in the industry. Dont support kickstarter style game development, youre doing a lot of their work for free.
I dont recommend the game in the state its in unless youre a early access type of person, if your time is valuable wait until it is released full version before looking again.
They had a discord that they removed all the channels and have read only, theres not really anyway to interact with the community unless they have a reddit or something, and just today decided to make emojis instead of work on the things that matter. 
The as i said small player base are also nearly the most unfriendly group of gamers i have come across (2k hrs in rust) so if you dont have friends to play with the harder missions are just too populated to do smoothly and a lot of time is spent trying to recover your body. They did just "fix" they spawn mechanic which reduces the longest runs but still CCRS2020.
It looks and plays really well (2080s) and should be a good game in the future if they can pull it all together.

So I decided to re buy deadside….
I refunded it a while back, not sure how long, maybe a year or so ago. 
It was on sale again,  and the reviews were mostly positive now, so I thought maybe it had improved a lot.
Yes I’ve not got many in game hours and that’s because I just find it boring and frustrating.

Here’s my Negatives….
1. Ai….. They are stupid…... I spawned into a new game after dying and all I had was a knife on me, I went into a building and about 7 Ai enemies came in to try and kill me. They had guns!
All I had to do was stand right next to them and slash away while they were shooting/reloading. I took no damage and killed them all with a knife using this method. Because I was stood right next to them they made no attempt to move away and the bullets never damaged me once.
But…
The other scenario is when at ranged attack they become sharp shooters and you can die easily,…

2. Aiming/Movement…. The whole mouse aiming and movement just feels rough and clunky. Very dayZ like which I hate and don’t find enjoyable at all. I really enjoy my fps games but this just feels rough….

I personally don’t think it’s ever going to be a game I look forward to playing, and I always seem to be a sucker for early access, occasionally they surprise.

I’m over my refund time now but I’m not bothered it wasn’t a fortune and you never know maybe in the future it will improve to a state were even I can enjoy it, but I think that’s many years away if ever imo…

Update: 05/02/2022....
I decided to go to a Medium difficulty zone on the map to take out the Ai and get some loot, I had maybe 2 hours in game and had a little gear, but some idiot who was geared up on a PVP server decided to just come and kill me (Yes that's PVP I understand), so all that work up to that point was wasted. 
Totally unfair fight. 
The game is just pointless in this scenario and I would highly suggest that you play PVE only unless you go on the server when its quite so you stand a chance to get better gear, so these fights are more fair!

I think I'm just used to playing far better games, you cant even reload next to walls, Aim over walls without moving back, It's impossible... 
Just a totally frustrating gaming mechanic that needs fixing imo...

Update: 09/02/2022...

Its Fun at times but Gun play is just too frustrating...
Died in the bunker, Couldn't get back to my body in time, Lost it all, so all my hours of game play, pointless... All because the gun play mechanics are terrible.

Likes:

3...Ai are inconsistent.

For an Early Access game, Deadside feels extremely polished, has enough content to keep things interesting and AI that works really well and provides a good challenge for those looking for PVE only. Even in beta form it is well optimised and relative bug free, in fact it is more stable than other similar games that have been out of early access for quite some time.

The map is a decent size, and is planned to be expanded later in the year. This, along with various other content that has been added to the road map for the coming year, means there is so much potential for the game to get even better. Personally, I feel like Deadside only loosely fits in the survival genre in its current form, but if you like those type of games and want something a little different from the typical zombie/monster/dinosaur shooters definitely check this out.

If your trying this now, keep one thing in mind.. its still in very early development... and this isnt a rant, just an observation. 

CONS so far
1) The enemy and its xray vision, night vision and spidey sense, sneaking up on them or trying to ambush them or even hiding in the bushes wearing a full gillie suit, they will see you and can make tactics very difficult at times. Sometimes you can sneak up behind then and pop off enough shots to kill them without them moving, other times they have their back to you and your 300 feet away, crouch walking, you could hear a mouse fart with the amount of noise your making,  and they will spin and get perfect shots on you. Tactics are a hit and miss to pull off. 
(example) During a Medium Difficulty raid, I had the attention of 3 guys who were all firing and focusing on me. My brother went from behind to flank, took nearly 1.5 to 2 minutes (real time.. and that can feel like a long ass time)  of crouch walking to get into position, started to aim at one person and the target did a instant 180 and killed my brother. 

2) The loot for the medium and hard missions are just not worth it, with the enemy and their awesome gunmanship abilities, you will find yourself going through lots of ammo and bandages with little reward to show for it. Sometimes we (my bro and I) discovered it was faster and more rewarding to tackle 2 easy missions than it was to complete 1 medium and there were more rewards to show for it overall..

3) There are no vehicles (yet) so getting around is time consuming. LOTS and LOTS of running.. specially if your dying a lot.. 

4) scavenging in the towns and communities is pretty bland, kill a few bad guys and search through houses to find that it was a waste of time.. nothing much to show for it.. sometimes you can get lots of ammo and a good supply of guns.. 

5) Respawn is VERY annoying, when you die you can only respawn at a town or community close to you, typically that can put you 800M - 1400M away from your body, and you have to go loot it to get your items back. Most of the time, the people who killed you are camping over your body and that can make it a tremendous pain in the a$$ to get it back. (remember they have spidey sense and xray vision, so trying to sneak to your body can be very VERY tough.. ) and respawn has a cool down, so if you die too quick trying to get your body back, you typically have to wait another minute or 2 before you can respawn in the same town 
NOTE: Be careful too.. you can only have 1 dead body marker on the map at a time, so if you die 1000M away and then die after you respawn in the town, your marker 1000M away will vanish and you will not know where your body was.

There are a few others, but at this time I have only played for 15 hours, this game has a lot of potential and the devs seem to be on top of things with communication with the players. 

So right now I would recommend this game.

I hope a lot of new types of missions (bunkers, large bases like an airport thats been converted, caves and secret dwellings) will be added to make exploring a desirable thing for the PVE players, im sure PVP is fun and all, but im not really into those types of game play, there are always a$$hat people who enjoy ruining a game that is PVP by being jacka$$es.. specially when you have to loot your dead body.

As you can see, I don't have many hours played; but I think I've played enough to generate an early opinion on the game... and there is so much potential here. So much. There are definitely some things holding the game back, but under all of that is something very special.

Some things "holding the game back", in my opinion (and some others' as well), would be:

- No vehicles or any way to traverse the map any faster than running.
          / Vehicles are on the Deadside roadmap, planned for 2022. There's many things Bad 
            Pixel need to sort out first (mainly server structure, stability/netcode).

- "Low" playerbase, SOMETIMES (depending on the definition of low to you).
          / Though I've never struggled to find a server to play on (NA East), I don't doubt that 
            some people have had some troubles, particularly outside of the US/high-pop parts of 
            the EU.
          / For reference, SteamCharts shows Deadside's AVG concurrent players to stay at 
            around ~600 when there hasn't been an update for a bit, and roughly ~1,000 when the 
            hype resurfaces. 

- Slow update pacing/consistency.
          / Update pacing & communication consistency has gotten insanely better as of late, 
            and I suspect that has something to do with the dev team (Bad Pixel) being acquired 
            by publisher TinyBuild, who are known to be quite the indie game publisher (Hello 
            Neighbor, Graveyard Keeper, SpeedRunners, and Hellpoint to be their most notable 
            titles as of late).

Despite the things I stated above, the game is very good, and there's no need to worry about things such as how the game is in Early Access. $20 (and even $30 for the supporter edition) is definitely a fair price for the content and fun you receive in return.

NOTE: As for all server-browser based games like Deadside, I recommend joining a non-official server. This way, there are general rules people have to follow (no safe zone camping, for example) & admins enforcing them; and there are also community discords to interact. As for the community: in my experiences, everybody has been extremely kind and welcoming. Almost every server I've joined, I get someone asking if I'm new, giving me tips/a guide to the game, and in some instances even offering me some amazing loot (weapons, armour, etc).

TL;DR: Good game with a good, welcoming community and good devs. Lots of potential and only going to get better throughout 2022 and beyond. Well worth the price, especially if you enjoy games like this.

Edited Review!

So basically I written a bad review after DeadSide came out of the alpha stage. In my review I complained about "No servers loading, which means I can't play the game at all!"

After a lengthy conversation with the devs in Twitter DM's they said that they were "currently working on a fix along with more features & optimizations." BTW I just want to say it wasn't just me with this issue!

I uninstalled the game until the issue was fixed but then never installed it till today. Now the game has had so many optimizations, totally new features & now on the PTS they have a totally new "Recoil System" which makes the game more refined but still familiar to the community.

It's nice to see that this company looks and acts on issues that the community witnesses. Not many AAA companies have the motivation to act on issues that plague their games *coughs* Daybreak & Raven Software.

Pros: 
The game is well developed, probably more developed than DayZ, but! There is more to do as well as it's easier to build, pvp and do pve stuff. Don't get me wrong, the game is really good for an early access game, but there is always room for improvements. 

Cons: 
When you open doors while standing to close, it teleports you away from the spot you were standing. Just now I opened a jail door in the bunker and got teleported in the wall and had to kill myself to get unstuck. I did lose all my best stuff and I was really angry because it took me a while to get all of that stuff. When you're 200m+ away from the bots, they still are able to kill you with any weapon. There are so many simple bugs that can be fixed easily, but it feels like they don't want to do them because as you can see, they're still creating new maps and adding more things into the game. 

Things that NEEDS to be fixed: 
- Door teleporting you when too close.
- AI shooting you with no line of sight.
- Bodies not being retrievable after dying in the water.
- AIs getting stuck in unnecessary places like doors, walls, windows & towers. 
- AIs being able to shoot you through the mountains.

Pros: The game is well developed, probably more developed than DayZ, but! There is more to do as well as it's easier to build, pvp and do pve stuff. Don't get me wrong, the game is really good for an early access game, but there is always room for improvements.

Cons: When you open doors while standing to close, it teleports you away from the spot you were standing. Just now I opened a jail door in the bunker and got teleported in the wall and had to kill myself to get unstuck. I did lose all my best stuff and I was really angry because it took me a while to get all of that stuff. When you're 200m+ away from the bots, they still are able to kill you with any weapon, when you die water you lose your body maybe add it able to float with your stuff?.

- Door teleporting you when too close.
- AI shooting you with no line of sight.
- Bodies not being retrievable after dying in the water.
- AIs getting stuck in unnecessary places like doors, walls, windows & towers.

I recommend this game if you're patient enough to wait for more to come, but not if you are looking for a DayZ alternative because that just isn't what you're getting in this game yet.

Deadside is one of my all-time favourite games. It is definitely my favourite game of the survival genre, due to so many reasons.

When I first saw Deadside show up on my recommended queue, I looked straight past it. To me, it looked like another DayZ and from the 'Mostly Positive' reviews I caught a bad drift. So in the end I ended up not buying it. 
But, I decided to take another look recently, and I actually just bought it as there was really not much else that interested me. I thought I'd give it a try and I was hoping for the best. My god, I am glad I took another look at this gem of a game and bought it.
So far, it has been the most extreme fun I have had (gaming-wise) in many months, maybe even longer.
The combat in this game, whether it be against 'Scavs' or other 'real-players' is super intense and leaves you satisfied after any gunfight you may get in to. The movement is fresh and so is the shooting.
Going on loot runs is super fun too!
It has a very welcoming community, and upon first playing, I was a solo player who knew absolutely nothing about the game, and everybody I met gave me gear, helped me out, told me so many great information. Just from playing the past 3 days, I have felt welcomed and have met many great people who I would be thrilled to play more with!

There are tons of things to grind for and looting is far more fun than other survival games.

I play on the EU 200 Server, hopefully I'll see you there!

This beats any other survival game in my opinion and I would highly recommend to get this game ASAP.#

The game in general is pretty bare bones and a good starting game for those who are new to the open world survival shooter. Do I recommend it? That would depend on what are you expecting, when I got it, I was expecting a DayZ like experience, and wouldnt you know it, that was exactly what I got with a twist slash bonus. Game doesnt revolve on PVP interactions to get loot. There are missions and constant events to keep you entertained without the need of other playes, though, keep in mind other players can got to the event site without notice and engage you. Crafting is pretty simple yet a bit tedious considering that there a no hints or guides for new players. The survival aspects is pretty basic, just eat and drink and you are pretty much good to go. The AI can be either stupid or damn right cracked and will at times flank you and pursue you if you are not aware of your surroundings.

Now my problem starts with one of its core mechanics, the shooting part. Along side its movement which feels clunky and unresponsive. You definitely need to practice alot i order to get the hang of things specially in firefight with both AI and players. Most times you are gonna be standing still so your aim doesnt jump all over the place. Another issue is the performance, this I might expressing on my personal side of things but the game crashes a lot despite having a decent rig. FPS goes all over and one second Im over 100 fps on low settings and then drops to low 30s maybe at times 20s. Sounds and animations need a ton of work cause it feels, looks and sounds trashy. like PS1 era trashy. Guns sound borderline the same across the board, might only identify if its rifle or pistol. thats it. It does not matter if its a shotgun, hunting rifle or ar it will sound the same, only give away would the rate of fire on some occasions. 

Over all, I give this game a 6/10 and im being generous due it having potential despite being simplistic. Hopefully the devs get their act together and rise to the ocassion.

First off I would like to say, this game is by no means a perfect game (No games are). It is in early access so it is expected that there will be a load of bugs and missing content here and there. On with the review now

I bought deadside roughly a year ago and I absolutely LOVE this game. For an early access game, the graphics are stunning, there are so many features, base building feels flawless, the proximity chat makes this game an absolute blast, and the ability to host your own servers off of GPortal is amazing for customizability! No server is alike and I absolutely love that. Some servers have loot drops cranked to high so you're always in the action with high tier loot, and some servers are a little more grindy and laid back. Some servers even host events with their communities! The game on its own if it didnt have these servers would be bland 100%. I just love that fact that even once you've done everything the game has to offer, you can also bank off of communities to make even more fun out of the game with their own ideas. This game is utterly stunning visually, and I 100% recommend it if you are looking to get into a rust/tarkov style game.

My only issues with this game is the scavs having deadshot accuracy through foliage. I could be through trees, bushes, and tall grass and one dude with a Mosin will absolutely destroy me without me even being able to see him. They do 100% need to adjust that because I've died more times than I'd like to admit because of that. Base building, although I said it was flawless, is REALLY tedious. Some servers can make it less tedious by having a starter kit that gives you some stuff to build your base, but not all servers do that. Loads of people complain about trees not falling down when you cut them, but I see that as a feature as you can build around a tree and have it inside your base so you can gather wood from safety to build up your base with ease. It does however take a really long time to gather wood from trees, and convert it from logs to planks, and from planks to either beams or plywood depending on whatever you're planning on making. I've noticed when cutting trees that sometimes it will say that you gain "2x Logs" or "4x logs" from hitting the tree. However it only actually gives you one log per 2 tree hits. If they actually incorporated RNG into the trees to make you have a chance to get more logs per hit, it would make the base process SO MUCH EASIER. My last complaint is with travelling. I have no clue if vehicles will become a thing, I saw the devs say that adding vehicles would take a long time because of hitboxes or something along those lines (which makes sense). But if they do actually incorporate vehicles I will literally be glued to this game permanently. Travelling is torture sometimes especially as they grow the map to be even bigger with every update. As they expand even more, boats and cars would be greatly appreciated.  

Never said this game is perfect, as it is in early access. I will say though, the developers seem extremely committed to the project, and I have no doubts that this game will go far once a few more vital updates release. I 100% suggest this game if you're on the fence about buying it. Just know what you're getting into when you buy it as it is in Early Access.

I would absolutely recommend this game! I'm about 20 hours in, have some great gear, a massive fort, and a good team of friends that I've met through Deadside. It's gameplay feels similar to DayZ Standalone, but no glitchy zombies to bug through a wall and kill you.  The in gane enemies are in human form, and some of them are actually pretty intelligent.  I've been stalked hundreds of meters by enemies that turned out to be bots. I'm thoroughly impressed with the base building mechanics.  It was actually fun to chop and build for about 6 hours! I only stopped because I ran out of money and materials.  The loot system and currency is very balanced.  You can easily make 50k in an afternoon,  if you complete missions and sell loot. The map and marking system are top notch. I don't have anything bad to say at all... so far, it's been perfect!

So... I don't usually leave reviews, but in this case I am doing so for people considering this or a number of other games. 

I want to start with saying I understand this is a small dev team and that I knew that going in. This game is not (to me) worth $15 - YET. Could it be? Sure, I see potential, but the issue is this game is a freakin running simulator at this point. 

The map is pretty large but super sparse. There are few buildings and what buildings there are I'd wager to say half are blocked off or severely limited (think like OG stalker). 

I was torn between this and SCUM and I wish I'd gone that route, there seem to be more players and more than just roving scavs. I am irritated about having to spend the majority of my time running around the map. It is mostly trees and fields - the "towns" are kind of a joke, we're talking 2-3 sheds in most cases. 

The gunplay is decent - not Insurgency or Rising Storm good... but decent. 

Graphics - real nice, no complaints there. 

Gear? Eh... could be more of a selection or customization. 

This is NOT Tarkov. It is like the step-child murder-hobo sim. If that. 

I hope this game gets better, we see cars and gear ubiquitous, and maybe even warring factions, idk, but as it stands, WAIT. Give this game a year or two or three (if it lasts that long - they can pull the plug at any point because as I said earlier I think this company is like 5 people?). 

If you love running in games - this game is for you. Not saying it can't be good but right now it feels like proof of concept at best and has no business being over $10. 

Oh well... will update if game improves and stops being running simulator 2022. I DO NOT recommend this game at this time.

THIS is what day z could have been, should have been, and probably wanted to be. There are no obnoxious, annoying and pointless zombies running around, The gun play is fun, realistic enough, without being overly done and annoying. The inventory system could be better, there is no auto splitting when trying to stack items like ammo, So if you have a stack of 84 ammo, and a stack of 24  ammo that are the same type, and want to create a stack of 100, you cant just drag and drop, you have to do the math, split it so that it hits 100 on the dot. Super annoying and not neccesary. You cannot put guns in bags which is extremely silly, if you want to balance it then you should have the guns take up more space or have them encumber the player. while reloading you cannot close or open doors, you cannot look in your inventory, its rather annoying. I love the map and ping system, it provides a ton of value and information to the player, and showing team mate position is extremely nice. I cannot wait for vehicles to be added to the game, as having to run 3-5 km everytime you die gets very boring and exhausting. Also not being able to put an EMPTY bag into an open inventory slot makes no sense at all. I would understand not being able to put a full bag into an inventory  space, but its current state doesn't make sense. All in all this game is great, with some patches, UI optimization, and added content, this game could easily be the best in the genre, It just doesn't have enough content to hold the attention of the player base for very long, and i think this is a contributor of why the servers seem empty. If you want a good hardcore survival game this is the ticket, just remember its not perfect, but its also got the potential to be just that in the future.

I recommend Deadside more of as an investment. Of course you can still get your money's worth especially if you have someone to play with since it is so cheap. 

But the game overall feels empty and doesn't have a lot to do in it. Transportation is also problematic since the map is big, somewhat empty, plain looking and there's nothing to drive either, at least not yet. Inventory management like item stacking, swapping and crafting needs to be reworked as it is also quite tedious and somewhat clunky. Base building is needlessly tedious and hard to do as well as not worth it because the trader is just the superior way to store your items since it cannot be raided. Lastly, it could use a better hitreg and net code.

Overall the game needs a lot work for me to invest more hours into. But it has a lot of potential that i don't want to see go wasted.

Game is good for such early development; but is set apart from other survival shooters by the clunky shooting mechanics and a very noob friendly and casual player base. Deadside is a game I have come back to multiple times but has the same flaws that make me leave after a few hours of play. The lack of reliable strafing and shooting leads to a very slow pace with a very fast time to kill, yet when playing to the games strengths as a solo you are quite frequently met with backlash from the community and server admins (since high pop 1st person only servers are mostly private) which commonly leads to a server wide witch hunt or a swift server ban. So if you are looking for a slow paced early development 1st/3rd person shooter which favors taking time and positioning over ego pushes and raw aim fights Deadside is a great game. Deadside is also very fun with friends and has a variety of servers tailored by private owners to make the game as fun as possible. However if you are like me and want something 1st person, skill intensive (specifically aim wise), and with a survival twist this isn't the game for that. Hope anyone reading this finds it helpful.

A game with a lot of potential but is killed by the people who run the servers. 

For the overall experience, even after playing well over 5 servers, I'm going to use the Sweet Baby Wayne's server for reference. We had just bought the game, loaded in, and had went to go look at the safe zones. When we got to one, on the Sweet Baby Wayne server, we were harassed by admins and moderators for being "poor" and not having much supplies or gear. Again, we had JUST bought the game no more than 20 minutes prior. We didn't say anything back and let them talk their smack. We left and came back to the safe zone a second time to STILL be harassed by the admins and mods. Finally we spoke up and called them out for treating new players like that and called them "tools". No more than 10 seconds later, myself along with 4 friends were all banned from the server.

We thought.. "Okay, it was just a bad server lets try another one". Got on the new server, meanwhile trying to figure out the entire game and the clunky mechanics, and began farming. We had made our way to the next safe zone to sell some stuff. Spoke once in game chat, and the SAME ADMIN FROM THE LAST SERVER is the admin of THAT server as well. He heard my voice and said "Oh I know who that is" and banned my friends and I for LITERALLY no reason.

That was my experience on Deadside and it pushed my entire group away. Sucks I played just slightly longer than the refundable amount because I would have instantly returned the game. Shitty communities on games ruin the chances for games to grow.
It has potential with concept and game design but the game just isn't there. Between it literally being a walking sim, and absolutely terrible AI it just isn't worth it right now.

Remember those old games from the 80's or 90's where the developers couldn't figure out how to make the game meaningful or worthwhile so they let the AI cheat and have an unfair advantage that was unattainable for players in order to artificially add content and increase difficulty? This game does that. Over and over again you will enter into combat and see that the AI is omniscient, knows where you are no matter how you maneuver and has godlike aim even if you are peeking quickly or running from cover to cover. Bad Pixel had a good idea for a game but couldn't figure out how to implement it without making the AI insanely efficient to the point where combat against them is meaningless and a waste of time. So, they made this thing. The PVP is meh. If you get this on sale for at least 50% off it might amuse you for 10 or so hours in PVP. Otherwise, it's a hard pass.

Let's be real... after playing this game for a while, I gotta say that Deadside needs a serious increase of CONTENT. There's just simply not enough to do on the game and Deadside just can't compete content wise with other games like DayZ, SCUM, Rust, etc.

What's the solution? Honestly... here me out. I think they should forget the DayZ clone and "Tarkov the ♥♥♥♥" out of this game! Make Deadside darker, grittier, increase the bots in areas. Add more zones, some type of extract system, give us more guns and customization options. Add more locations, make a base system or something similar to Tarkov's (a place to store loot). Simply put... make an "Open World" Tarkov Game.

If the developers do that... this game will have a huge market of hungry players logging in all the time. Instead of empty servers or servers with a maximum of 10 players.

So please developers and rich people who bought the company recently... Tarkov the ♥♥♥♥ out of Deadside!

Game has a lot of potential. I came back to it after seeing they did a big update which included base raiding and boss npcs. That didn't fix many of the underlying problems in my opinion, even though it was a good addition to the game. But with that being said, I want to like this game, so that's why I'm putting the time into this text wall in hopes the devs see it and make changes.

The biggest problem in my opinion is the world being way too big to have to run everywhere. I feel like 2/3 of my play time is spent running. I had a cargo drop 4km away and ran toward it, got 3k in and it disappeared. I was the only one on the server. Add a timer for events/missions please.
I see car batteries and spark plugs to loot and sell, so I'm assuming they will be adding vehicles at some point. When I see that update I'll be excited to check it out and possibly change my review.

Another glaring problem is the bots having sniper rifles, and almost no items adding armor until late game(I think?). Matter of fact, you lose half your storage if you wear a vest that has armor, because it doesn't have storage slots, which is a useless mechanic imo. It's frustrating to run an easy mission and get one-tapped by a bot with a sniper rifle because I have no armor. Maybe only allow bots in epic missions to have snipers.

Speaking of storage, you can't carry extra guns. Guns are what you sell to make the most money from what I've seen, and if you take a good gun out to use, you can't loot other guns to sell. It says you can use a special backpack to store them in but I haven't found it yet. I had the most expensive backpack I could buy and still couldn't store guns.

Items have no tooltips displaying stats. I have no idea what's an upgrade and what isn't. Is military clothing better than others, or is it all cosmetic? Is the gun I found better than what I have equipped? I have no idea, and I don't want to have to watch youtube videos and memorize what people have tested.

I don't like the respawn system. You have to use tokens to respawn at set locations, which isn't a bad idea, but if I do a mission that's close to my base and die, I can't respawn at my base because it's too close. That's really annoying to random spawn on the other side of the map or at a trader that's way further than my base.

You can only have 3 storage chests in your base (6 if you count the three tiny chests you can also get) I like to hoard items, so this is a minor problem for me.

With that being said, I really like how the game looks, and the wide variety of guns.

 I like how you can't be offline raided like in Rust. You have to be killed and drop a raid token, creating an hour window that your base is able to be raided. The base building is different, and a grind, but I do like that too. Building scaffolding to attach your walls/floor/roofs to, it's a cool idea. Even if 100k for a single lock to secure your base is very high. 

The game is well optimized and runs smooth. Active devs and solid servers.

I feel bad leaving a negative review on this game, knowing that if a few of these major problems were fixed, it would easily be a great game that I'd put hundreds of hours into. But I just can't recommend it now. I was going to buy it for a friend, but I'll wait until vehicles are added. Keep up the good work devs, you're on to something with this game.

The game is intense and the gunplay feels amazing, but right now, the game doesn't really want to go in one direction or the other. 
For now, the community is split between PvE and PvP, basebuilding is badly done and lacks depth. Playing with friends is currently a burden, seeing as there is no way to spawn together in as a team, even on a PvE-Only server, forcing you to run over half the map to find one another.

For me personally, it would be amazing to see the devs turn the game completely in to a PvE setting and add a little personality to the game, not in the name of zombies, but something akin to the STALKER series, which would help build a story for the game and immensly improve the atmosphere.

This game is GREAT! A Very well balanced survival shooter. I like that even as a complete noob who has just joined you can kill experienced fully geared players with only a knife, if your movement is good and if you are sneaky enough. So going from nothing to the best gear within a couple seconds is possible if you are a bit lucky. I also love the absence of stats, k/d ratios and everything in terms of player "rating". It is stripped down to the bare minimum of what a game like this needs to be great. The landscape is in my opinion very well done and the love for detail in nature sounds is pretty nice, especially because this game is still in development. I am eagerly awaiting the update which will bring an expanded map with lots of new POIs among loads of other things. I would like to see a bit more work done in terms of the inventory. I feel you have to be very exact when dropping things into a slot. Also please increase the size of the area you need to click when picking up items from the floor. Ladders are also kind of hard to click. Especially when coming from the top. This makes quickly picking up loot in a firefight very hard. All in all great game and I hope you folks all buy the supporter pack to further push development. In my opinion theres not really a way around the supporter pack because inventory size is VERY limited in this game and it does give you quite an advantage. Especially in the early game when you don't have a base to store your stuff in. Please keep up the great work! Much love!

I highly recommend if you enjoy survival games. This game does not hold your hand and is a decent challenge in the beginning.

PROs:
~ Decent starting challenge. Fighting enemies and finding weapons and resources is not a cake walk having only a knife.
~ Large, open, detailed map.
~ All the general survival game stuff. Resource collecting, base building, etc.
~ Combat is a good challenge. The lack of hit markers and hit direction indicators makes you use caution instead of just run and gunning it. 

NEUTRAL:
~ Inventory space is very limited. This leads to some aggravation when looting, but makes you stop and consider what would be more useful.

CONs:
~ The large map makes it a pain to get around at times.
~ Lack of weapon/gear stats in descriptions sometimes makes it difficult to make gear decisions.
~ Land claiming is a bit too restrictive, especially on PVE servers.
~ The AI enemies are pretty aggressive and the lack of markers occasionally lead to deaths without even knowing where you're shot from.

I'm going to do a more detailed review on Deadside later but for now I'll say a few words about it. If you take H1Z1, Day Z (standalone), Escape from Tarkov and Infestation: The New Z and combined them into one game you'd have Deadside. However, you won't find zombies in this game, just bots with a hellauva good aim. Would I recommend this game, well if you liked 2 out of the 4 games I mentioned then yes, and if you liked 4 out of 4 of the games then this is a dead ringer for you! Remember this is an early access game, so you'll find a lot of bugs and glitches otherwise it's pretty fun with or without other human players.

Firstly, I feel like this is ´´the´´ Early Access game. It´s one of the cheaper ones, but it sure beats almost all the others.
Maybe not in depth, but more like in the whole package category. 

The gameplay loop is simple enough - you do a couple of missions, and once you have a decent inventory at the trader,
it will take you a very short time to loot up and be back in the action with the most geared guys in your server.

Thank god hunger isn´t a problem in this game (it´s very basic, theres a plenty of food and i´d love for it to stay that way.

At around 15-hour mark I felt like I´ve done almost everything this game has to offer. Endgame and raiding for me is also very basic at the moment and personally I would play something else if I was looking to raid.

The AI is a bit weird at the moment, bots shhoting trough the bushes while being completely invisible to the player
isn´t fun. At least for the player.

The game is far from ready, but there´s much fun to be had right now. Can´t wait to see what this game will be in a year
or so. The budget Tarkov + budget DayZ approach hits the spot for me. Just please don´t ruin it.

Overall it´s a good game for the price and I can´t wait for future updates.

This game definitely has potential, however in its current state, I couldn't recommend it, even on discount.

First and foremost, let's discuss the pros:

-Combat is very much like any hardcore combat game, Tarkov, PUBG, etc. there is a minimal hud so you know what you're doing, but it doesn't interfere with gameplay to the point where it feels arcade-y.
-The world is well developed to an extent. I'm guessing some of the map is either undeveloped and is roadmapped for a later date, but it's sort of a weird shape. Also, from what I found there's no transportation other than foot travel, so you best be okay with running long distances. I'm okay with this, but it definitely feels like there should be better modes of transportation.
-The inventory system is unique and I kind of like it. You don't have infinite space in your backpack and thankfully not limited by a weight system. Each equipment item you use has inventory space, so it's not like you're limited to a small backpack.

Again, the game has promise, however after playing under 2 hours with someone else, I refunded the game. Here's why:

-The crafting and building system is probably the worst I've ever experienced (and I play a lot of crafting games). I could have been doing something wrong, but at the root of the system, there are glaring flaws. For instance, placing a land claim was incredibly difficult. It's literally just a sign you put in the ground somewhere, and it took us 15 mins just to find an acceptable place to the game. The logic behind building a base seemed incredibly complex. I can understand needing a "scaffold" to build on top of, but you can't place walls on top of a scaffold with an existing deck. You'd think that a wall would sit nicely on top of a deck right? Wrong. If the game is going to claim anything about base building/survival, this needs to be fixed. This was the main reason I refunded my purchase.
-The AI is kind of broken. I actually enjoyed being randomly ambushed by AI, but they usually held pistols/shotguns and tried to shoot me from a 100 yards away giving up their position before I could easy kill them. On the other hand, attacking events/missions and the AI would headshot me from 300 yards out. It just seemed like you either fought AI turned down to 1 or turned up to 100.
-After just short of 2 hours of gameplay, my friend and I felt like we've already seen all the game has to offer. The missions were short lived, simple go here, attack this... Perhaps we were missing the premise, but at its core, the game felt one dimensional and empty. This is where I hope to see the most improvement. Well, this and crafting/building.

All said, I really hope this game takes off. It is fun, but fundamentally broken in its current state. I would love for the devs to release server files for private servers, because this is something I could see myself and friends sinking tons of hours into someday.

A good hardcore multiplayer shooter/survival focusing on pvp and pve action with base building and some good ideas. The gunfeel is great in my opinion. Still in early access at the time of my review but already very promising. 

The game is well optimized and pretty nice at times. The content is a bit lacking now but it's already very enjoyable if you like games like Tarkov, Dayz or even Rust. Here in contrary to some other multiplayer openworld survival games no need to run a long time, or risking a flu, for looting deadly weapons and have great gunfights in this game.

The sound system could be improve and the world could be deeper but nothing really important is missing or really broken from what I saw. The core gameplay loop is good and rewarding.

For the tacticaI shooter games fan I am, I would definitly recommend it, even more at this price tag.

This game is something brand new for the Survival genre, it can be related to the game Stalker. It is very well Optimized, it also delivers High quality graphics even on the lower end systems. DeadSide has a great community as being able to team up with other players is very easy and a lot of fun. Other things to do in DeadSide (And I mean a LOT more to do) is that you can Construct bases, fortifications, easy and simple crafting and a lot of action against players and AI controlled enemies (Which are pretty well programmed to fight). You even get cool gadgets like a walkie talky that you can find as a loot item or craft it in the devices section. Multiple types of dynamically generated missions and lots more!
